text: I was assaulted by an employee of handlebar and treated differently (by all of the staff including the manager on duty) from the white people that I went there with. As a former semi frequent diner there, Handlebar service is generally poor. I never minded because I enjoyed the food until I went there with my wife and several friends and experienced racist and hostile behavior from the manager, and waiter and I was even physically assaulted by the bus boy. As the only black person in my party they were rude and insulting to me specifically and their behavior changed only when I left after being shoved repeatedly by the bus boy (I did not retaliate).  I would not have written a review but this is a pattern since I am not the only black person that I know to have been mistreated and treated differently from white patrons.  Since, according to Yelp I am not allowed to "draw conclusions about the broader business practices of the business" based on my own experience, I am not going to say Handlebar is racist. I will say that I experienced racist behavior from literally everyone at Handlebar during the period of time that I have described herein. I will never go here again, and you shouldn't either.

This is my second experience at handlebar where I walked out sourly disappointed in the food. The service was decent. We ordered an assortment of tacos and the black catfish and grilled fish tacos were inconsumable. Incredibly salty and bitter. Their kale salad was bland. This restaurant is located in an area that has a surplus of taco venues so I would definitely skip this for other options if I'm looking for tacos. Don't recommend.
One of the best Vegan spots in the city. This place does not dissapoint!

The sloppy joe was great. Very delish and well.. sloppy. The contents completely fell out of my burger and onto my plate but it was great eating it with a fork.  Big portions of food especially the amount of fries it came with. I was pretty full with just the burger.  I really liked the calming vibe and friendly service. They added water ya needed it, but wasn't hovering around your space.

I have been coming here for years and absolutely love this place.  It's great for Wicker Park to have vegetarian options and I think they should have more. The ambience of Handlebar is no frills, but is a divey, rustic aesthetic. They also have a lovely patio in the back when it's summer, which is super enjoyable. The service here is always good and fast too.  I have had the same waiter here for years and he's always on top of things. The vegan buffalo wrap has been my go to meal here for years!  The buffalo seitan is chopped up into little bits and has a great, potent buffalo flavor, I wish they would put more buffalo sauce on there actually.  Their vegan ranch is so tasty and I don't like regular ranch.  The wrap comes with a side and my favorite is the smoked gouda mac and cheese.  It's just so fulfilling in every way.  I have also tried the fried pickles and mozzarella sticks.  Both are very good and have delicious breading.  My other favorite is the chili cheese fries.  The vegetarian chili is amazing with fresh peppers in there, the fries are seasoned soooo well, and the cheese on there is a nice cheddar cheese.  I always want to eat too much of this. I have had their Chicago Style Tofu sandwich and was underwhelmed by it.  It was kind of bland and there was not enough giardiniera in there.  This is why I took off a star. Their brunch is also a success.  I love their vegan biscuits and gravy, it's so hard to find a good vegetarian biscuits and gravy. Their drinks are also reasonably priced and I love their unique ideas like a vegan White Russian.  Their bloody marys are also creative and decadent.  Just try it once at least because there are so many delicious toppings in there like a fried pickle! I will continue to come here for the delicious vegetarian cuisine, reasonable prices, and tasty drinks.

My husband and I have given Handlebar SO MANY chances because we wanted so desperately to have another option for veg and vegan food in the city. We've been disappointed every single time by the poor quality of service (that feeling of being served by a person who is too proud/too much of a hipster to be in service to you) and the totally mediocre food.  The main reason we kept coming back is because it's one of the few restaurants in the city that has Tex Mex style queso. And it's pretty hard to get queso wrong. During our last and final attempt several months ago, we dropped in for a drink and some queso after work. We added guac to our dip order because...when is guac ever a bad idea?The menu listed queso and chips at whatever the price was and then an additional charge to add guacamole.  When our food came out, we immediately noticed that we received the same amount of chips for the two dips that usually comes out with just the queso (which we had ordered many times before). We were just halfway through our dips when the chips ran out (no surprise) so we asked for more. The waiter notified us that we could have some but at a charge.  So, I guess we were supposed to eat the rest of our queso with a spoon? Or we should ration our chips? Shouldn't the additional chips be included in the costs of the added dip that we were already paying for? We asked to speak with the manager on duty. Upon arrival, she was salty and unapologetic...and clearly didn't grasp the logic of the situation put in front of her, going off on a tangent about how expensive ingredients are currently (which directly contradicts what is actually happening in the economy) and how their chips are homemade. Clearly zero training or experience dealing with customers in these types of situations. BTW, if you've ever fried chips at home, you'll know how cheap it is. And this would be the perfect opportunity for Handlebar to provide (almost) free value to its customers. Businesses are always a reflection of the owner and this one is full of a bunch of low energy stoners who were never taught how to provide good service. The owners clearly don't know anything about customer service (or they don't care) and would rather offer very little value at a high price than create a repeat customer.  The staffing and pricing issues reflect the inexperience/carelessness of ownership. Be more hands on, solve these issues, and try to understand Lifetime Customer Value. That'll beat the strange food cost strategy of surprising customers with an extra charge for something required to consume another item they've ordered.
We came in for a quick overnight trip to Chicago and I was excited to try Handlebar, as I'm a lifelong vegetarian.  Great food in a cool space, and the service was impeccable - above and beyond.

Visited the Handlebar for brunch yesterday and I'm still dreaming about my meal. Ordered the Diablos which is eggs, cheese, tostadas, black beans, rice and a red chipotle sauce. Similar to huevos rancheros. Added the avocado- of course- and also a side of potatoes. The combination was to die for. I could have easily split with a friend- portion was large- but instead I forged ahead because it was so good! Friend ordered a Bloody Mary and a mini beer which looked amazing. Our third person ordered the fried avocado grilled cheese and had no complaints either. Don't let the vegetarian or vegan menu scare you- this place rocks! If I could eat here everyday I'd give up meat. Seriously.
Great food!!!! I was in the mood for great food I highly recommend this place the staff is friendly and made my dinning experience extremely pleasant

This was a fantastic breakfast for my vegetarian family.  We enjoyed great service on a rustic and beautiful back patio with constant refills of our water and coffee. My husband had a delicious bloody mary with a fried pickle!  All of our food was made from scratch and the re and time was obvious from my son's HUGE egg and seitan sausage sandwich on yummy bread to the sides of the most scrumptious breakfast potatoes I've had.  I had the pepitas and it was phenomenal with delicious peppers and fried onions. Husband he a huge and savory breakfast burrito and another son had the half order of biscuits & gravy. All the food was unique, with huge portions.  So happy we discovered this place!
While leaving the bathroom someone was leaving a bit in front of me.  And he went into the kitchen. Not a big deal other that he didn't wash his hands!!!  Gross!!!

Excellent food and ok service. My boyfriend had the biscuits and gravy with tofu and it was really good. It was so flavorful and probably the best we've had. I had the vegan breakfast burrito and that was good too. It had lots of flavor and the tortilla wasn't too thick like a burrito usually is. It came with beans that tasted yummy as well.  Overall the food was great and one of the better vegan/vegetarian spots in the city!

I wish I could give 6 stars. This is a must-know restaurant for all veggie/vegan Chicagoans. It's been a very long time since I had imitation meat products that I actually enjoyed. Imagine my delight when I was able to order a Sloppy Joe and be fooled into thinking there was meat. I come here often with friends who are meat free, only eat fish, and/or eat all meat and I have never heard a complaint. The wait for brunch on a Saturday or Sunday can be long so be prepared but they have $4 mimosas Saturday which helps the wait! I highly recommend the chili cheese fries with vegan queso as well. This is my #1 spot in the city!

We sat outside for dinner around seven pm on a Thursday and the back seating area was quaint and comfortable. The service was prompt and glasses of water came to the table immediately (which I love) before we were greeted by our server.  All three of us ordered their version of a Bloody Mary with the baby beer back (Miller high life glass bottle) and a fried pickle/olives/pepper/lemon wedge. The Bloody Mary wasn't too spicy and very good in my opinion.  For my entree I ordered the fish tacos and it came with their famous vegan chili and brown rice. There were 3 fish tacos with the dish (which is a great portion) but the tilapia was a little too blackened for my taste. I love blackened chicken and fish usually but this was a little too charcoal tasting for me personally.  The vegan chili had great flavor and was very good. It was a big portion so I shared the chili with the table and gave my third fish taco to a friend (who agreed the fish was too blackened) and we went on our way. All in all it was a good experience though.  Pros- Bloody Mary Cocktails/Vegan Chili Cons- Rats in the alley kept scampering by/fish was a little over cooked

Quickly becoming my go to spot! Great food, decent drinks, and rotating specials.  Many vegetarian dishes and great vegan options. Nice big patio and Metallica is frequently playing on the stereo which is a plus to me!

food is decently priced... nice ambiance at night and outdoor patio seating!  -don't get the vegan queso fries tho bc they are MUSTARDY! iDK WHY THEY TASTE LIKE MUSTARD TO ME!!! weird consistency too. but the plain fries are a-ok ;p -if u are a vegan don't get the avocado toast thing veganized bc once again, it's mustardy af and the bread is always stale -hi

Really cute place with nice patio outside that is surprisingly big. I really enjoyed my food (fried avocado tacos with refried beans, brown rice, and cabbage slaw). They have a nice drink selection and everything is relatively inexpensive. However, I was disappointed in the service as it took us over an hour to receive our food and the server was not the friendliest.

I am a vegetarian and was meaning to try this place for the longest time! The nachos and chili cheese fries were on point! But the chimichanga, and French toast were underwhelming. We ordered an iced chai tea latte and it was so milky, lacked flavor. The server was nice enough to take it out of our bill since we didn't like it. I will come back to try some other dishes.
Food was good but they don't allow substitutions so you can't customize orders to be vegan to your liking which is annoying .
Delicious - I loved the egg and sausage sandwich and my boyfriend raved about the Mean Green sandwich. Great drip coffee and good service!

This place is technically "pescatarian" and so am I, so I was SO excited upon discovering it a couple years ago.  The food is generally fresh and delicious, and they have great drink specials. My favorite is the shrimp and grits! I've visited many times, at different times of day and different days of the week. On my last TWO visits, I experienced absolutely awful service. I thought the first time it had to be a fluke. Our order was taken, our food took over 30 minutes to be delivered and that was it. We were never checked on, nobody apologized, and after waiting an extra 15 minutes when we finished eating, I went up to the hostess asking for a check. It was so disappointing since I was introducing the place to my vegan friend for the first time. Fast forward to a few weeks later, and I brought my sister-in-law there for the first time. We also experienced the exact same minimal, forgotten service. Food came out quick this time. But we were never checked on. And after sitting there looking around, holding our credit cards in our hands, clearly done with our meal for ATLEAST 15 minutes, we finally got up and asked the hostess for our check. The fact that this happened twice in a row has now turned off me and both of the new guests I brought there. I don't think any of us plan to return.

Food was pretty good! Its good for groups that are vegan and non vegan but not so much gluten free. The service was just ok.I would come back but in 2017 I don't eat where I can't work and I didn't see a single black worker . But for many customers who probably cud careless I'm sure you'd like it. Prices are reasonable and drinks are good.

I literally spaced out and transported to another universe eating the vegan pesto tofu sandwich. It's one of those sandwiches where the textures and flavors marry so prefect together you forget it's vegan. When I didn't know what to choose for a side the waitress said the mac n cheese was really good. I don't order dairy often but she sold me and it was unreal good. I would love to see a vegan side dish alternative as good as this.

the vegetarian entrees here are amazing! loved the full flavour they have in the dish, especially the black bean maduro one is awesome, the sweet plantain mixes really well with the black bean and the diced tomato. the sambal tofu entree is amazing too, a bit on the salty side, but the sour and spicy flavour is amazing the ambience is very hipster and the wait can be long during peak hours

Likes: their nachos are loaded.  Their chili is divine.  I crave their mac and cheese as you can taste the smoked Gouda.   Dislikes: their pretzel bun sandwich is just not very good. Neither is their buffalo wrap.   But for the love of god their mac and cheese is on point and I dream about it whenever I'm on a diet.
The chili mac and cheese was really good. Three stars because of smoking area in the patio out back.

Food was good. Ordered a salad with fried avocado. Michelada was good too. The hibiscus cooler was better. Only complaint is that it took 25 minutes after being seated for our waiter to come get our drink order.
Visiting from PHX and stopped by this joint. Even non-vegans in the group loved their entrees. Delicious and affordable. Street parking only so that can be a beast...but worth it.

Casual vegetarian restaurant and bar with a quaint patio in the back.  Most of their options are vegetarian, but there are a handful of fish or vegan options too. And believe me they have avocados.. fried, fresh, mashed, mushed, you name it!  I had the Black Bean Tostados with real cheese (pass on vegan "cheese", thank you). They were really tasty, crispy, bean-y and of course.. avocado-y. It was easily split between 3-4 of us for an appetizer (it comes with 3 tostadas). I ordered the Green Meanie for myself, which is avocado (surprise, surprise), goat cheese, spinach, tomato, sprouts all on a very grainy multi-grain bread. I enjoyed the avocado & cheese obviously, but was slightly distracted by the mound of sprouts. I would probably venture out and get something different next time.  Wednesday night is $3 draft beer night, which was an added bonus! Looks like I've found a new Wednesday night spot!

I had the biscuits and gravy with a side order of French Toast. Yes, I can eat! When I wasn't starving anymore, I didn't love the biscuits and gravy. It was too salty but the French toast was bomb though.

We love trying vegetarian restaurants. When we moved to wicker, we were super excited to try this place right away. Let's just say this place is eclectic-- definitely a different crowd but really a cool place. They have brunch and a good beer and drink list. We went for a late lunch so had the lunch menu to choose from.  Everyone was satisfied with their food, but not in love with any of it. The sandwiches have a LOT of bread and not too much substance really. We'll probably go again down the road and try some new options. Hopefully for dinner!

went there for lunch during the week and there was only two people at the restaurant, Our server seated us right away and sat us further back instead of the front area, either way , he got our order and got our coffee right away.   slowly people got there, just a few and by this time we got our food, it was OK.  Our server got allergies or had the flu but was able to serve us.  The place looks nice and nicely decorated.

For your late night cravings, Handlebar offers a great variety of vegetarian and vegan options, accompanied by a vast selection of wine and spirits. Our server was fantastic and he was able to describe every single dish to us and made fantastic recommendations. The parking is available off street and usually easy to find. I'll definitely come back next time I'm in Chicago.

Wow. Outstanding. Very friendly staff that listens to all. Good beer. Had the tofu sandwich with side of vegan gravy. Wow!  Very good. Folks here are fun and talkative. Only a few things why not 5 stars - bar and food Menus seem a little dirty and no paper towel as they use blowers. Rid this as they are filthy on blowing germs all over a bathroom and the blower itself contains all sorts of germs. I will live. Overall nice place.

Ive went here a few times now - always happy with the food here and have left feeling awesome! Specials: the sunday night avacado tacos w tecate+tequilas are amazing. Tacos are flavorful and the tequila is a good combo along with a tecate chaser. There used to be a fish n chips special which was my fav but it is no longer offered :( Cocktails: i havent been disappointed so far, the crabbiea primm cup is awesome. Water service: they give you two filled cups and a carafe full of water-you dont run out and Im a camel Chili mac attack - great savory cheese taste with some crunch of tortilla chips and spiciness from jalapeños. This is one dish that generates random cravings during the day to come back to the restaurant Grits - so-so grits, they come out warm and are just alright Green meanie - one of the best vegan sandwiches - the avacado and whatever sauce they put in is awesome

Dark atmosphere, good creative food. Got the green meanie and it was a delicious sandwich - avocado and sprouts and some good sauce - highly recommend if you like sandwiches! This place will make you forget that it's vegan- nothing lacking or missing at all. But don't think vegan means healthy, some dishes are definitely not! My husband got the chili mac attack and the pasta was soft and chewy. Delicious.

A real chef must work here.  Very impressive, thoughtful and creative flavors !   I'm never excited to try the rest of the menu, but am here!   A non vegetarian, picky eater, hard to impress... friend was also impressed by the vegan entree " Sambal Tofu"  $3 beer special happy hour.  Our male waiter was very kind and helpful, thanks!
Cool little hip and trendy vegan bar. Nice people, nice atmosphere, and good food. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Chicago.

One of my favorite veggie restaurants in the city. It has a great atmosphere. The inside is cozy in the winter, and there's usually outdoor seating in the summer.  I've tried several awesome items on the menu, but I keep coming back for the vegan buffalo chicken wrap, it's my all time favorite! This is also a solid brunch spot.

Cute little spot.  Nachos were good. Usually can't go wrong with nachos.  Country fried Portobello dish I got was okay. I personally wasn't feeling it. Strong pepper taste. Perfect if you like that kind of dish. A bit dry.

This place is a personal favorite, even as an avid meat eater. In the year that I've lived down the street, coming in once every month or two, the service has ALWAYS been top notch. The food is delicious and varied - I can't tell whether or not I like their regular or brunch menu more. Some tips - go sit in their patio later this season at night, bring someone you like conversing with, and enjoy their food&drink. I have a hard time ordering anything other than the Green Meanie. The Sambal Tofu and Ground Nut Stew are also especially fantastic. Only caveat is avoid Friday and weekend nights as this place will be PACKED as it's one of a few really good casual&queer friendly bars in this neighborhood.

Came here on a whim looking for vegan food. Was blown away! The diablo special was seriously one of the better meals I've had in months and was 100% vegan. The atmosphere was great and the service was on point. Strongly recommend :)

Amazing food and service! I had the fried avocado tacos and they were so good. I'm craving them already. We also had two starters: vegan chili cheese fries and the avocado dip w/chips. They were both excellent! I can't wait to go back!

Neither I nor my sister like pancakes but how can you pass up boujee brunch served in a bowl of pancakes? You can't. Everything was delicious, pancakes included. The country fried portobello kind of blew my sister's mind, and she's usually a snob about vegan things, you know how it is. We shared those two brunch items between the two of us and had a lot of leftovers to finish for breakfast at home the next day. What a great weekend!

Handlebar is my go-to brunch spot in Chicago. As a vegan, it is one of the only brunch places that has plentiful, creative, and delicious options. It is a nice compromise if you have omnivore friends joining you as they also serve dairy and eggs for those skeptical of a totally vegan spot. Their boozy brunch drinks are amazing, especially the bloody mary. It comes with an amazing fried pickle and if you ask they will make it VERY spicy. I highly recommend the chimichanga for brunch (I love the vegan version and friends swear by the onmivore version) and my husband loves their biscuits and gravy (vegan). Also, Tuesday's queso burger deal is baller and the Black Bean Maduro for dinner is one of my favorite meals.

I love this place so much. It is currently my favorite restaurant in the city. Great for brunch, lunch and dinner. I am not a vegetarian by any means but that doesn't matter. They also have a pretty large outdoor patio in the back for summer days. I was thinking I wanted to bring my sister in law here with her new baby but it's probably too tight a squeeze to bring strollers indoors....I did see a young girl there tonight though.  I'm a sucker for their breakfast burritos but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Best of all, it's cheap!
OK restaurant. The atmosphere was too loud for my liking. I felt like I had to yell in order for my boyfriend to hear me. The food was average.

Traveling from NYC on my last day wanted to have breakfast at Handlebar because of the vegan options. Got there at 10:33 and they were still closed and were not going to open at 11:00. Mind you they're suppose to open at 10:00am.  Very sad and disappointed.

Came here on a Friday night at 6:30PM without a reservation with two of my GFs and did not have to wait for a table at all! There was a lot of mood lighting going on, and the hipsters were spread out as far as the eye could see. The menu is very vegan and vegetarian friendly. I was feeling moderately healthy, so I ordered the blackened catfish with sides of sesame broccoli and smoked gouda mac. I really liked the flavors of the sides, but the catfish was extremely salty. I also wasn't a huge fan of all the black pepper that it was doused in. I tried my friends' shrimp and grits which was actually really rich and appropriately flavorful. I also tried the fried plantains which were bomb. I would love to come back to try some of the other vegetarian options, particularly the tofu dishes, but the catfish I could have done without.

Love this place:  their menu, patio, decor, except their super super super loud heavy metal music. I don't mind that you are setting a mood but so distracting to the point of desperation. I have to mentally prepare for it every time I come.   I would come back more often but your volumen of music is way too high for my own sanity.  My recommendation is bring earplugs or ask for patio sitting which surprisedly is serene and quiet.

I just got carry out but this little vegetarian bar had a nice vibe while I waited. It wasn't too noisy or anything snd staff was friendly. The fried avocado tacos were excellent; reminding me of falafel. The Chicago style was excellent too. Lots of garlic but it was tasty. It didn't feel at all like a vegetarian meal, it was filling and sat well. I was surprised how well it traveled too, this is often a challenge with vegetarian dishes. I'll definitely be back.

I love this place and wish it long life on North Ave. Staff is accommodating, friendly, professional but still punk :)  Very nice vibe. I get the Ground Nut Stew pretty much every time I go. I've even cracked open the laptop at the bar on a Saturday to kill some work. Highly recommended.

It's like a vegetarian Kumas corner. Can't believe it's taken me this long to check it out.  Do any other vegetarians not know how to order when they go to a vegetarian restaurant?  I'm not used to menus having more than 1 to 2 veggie options. I get overwhelmed with all the possibilities and have to outsource my meal decision to the waiter.   All in all the food is pretty decent. Happy to have a veg spot with a bar. Looking forward to returning over the summer for some late night eats / drinks on the patio.

My sister and my friend and I shared our meals and it was all delicious. Ended up being $40 for all of us without drinks so was pricey for students on a budget but worth it for the great vegetarian and vegan selection. Highly recommend the biscuits and gravy w tofu, the french toast, and the fried pies (the filling that day was pb&j, sounds odd but was delicious) If you try and go for Sunday brunch like we did expect a wait! Glad we were outside on the patio it was lovely, the inside was dark and noisy.

So this review could be considered informed as I've eaten at Handlebar occasionally for the last ten plus years.  Their menu is solid and if you're feeling like a vegetarian who just wants to drown in the comfort of cheese get the gouda mac. Breakfast quality off one time as of late, specifically the omelette, so perhaps a new cook?  Lots of meal experience short....  Try the: nachos, catfish, Mac, all regular brunch items especially diablos (omelette was a special), salads, tostados, maduro, nut stew and drinks. Only things I always skip are the buffalo chicken tofu wrap, grits, and the fried pickles. Just a matter of taste really, as their food is made with fresh ingredients and tastes great. It lands on the greasy side of the scale.  Loud music, and if busy expect to wait. A favorite place to meet old friends and catch up, back in the day I had a few first dates here.

I'm not a vegan, but I was blown away by the delicious food. I had the fried avocado tacos and it was incredibly flavorful! The sauce it came with was amazing. I also tried the vegan confetti cake, which was actually pretty good for a vegan cake. The texture reminds me of carrot cake and the frosting was good too. I'm definitely coming back!
Horrible customer service, had a very bad attitude. Hostess was very snarky and became angry when we asked her questions. After that, we left and went to another restaurant.

Delicious vegan friendly restaurant. Vegan item are clearly marked.  Friendly service. Nice patio in the warmer months. I usually go for brunch. My current favorite is the pepita scramble. So delicious! When I started a vegan diet many years ago I tried almost all of the veg friendly places in chicago. Only a handful have been places that I have consistently come back to and this is one of those. Highly recommend.

Why leave 1 star? Because of the harassment my boyfriend and I received here. Our waiter was a bit standoffish and seemed to be in a bad mood. He wasn't very attentive and we had to ask the host to get his attention more than once. Because of this, we decided not to leave a tip and just pay with the next bill up ($37). We left and had walked a reasonable distance from the restaurant and we see the waiter (a youngish, tall lanky white guy) running after us screaming about our change. When he catches up to us he gets in my boyfriends face and starts going off about how dare we not tip him and that he didn't need our 24 cent tip (which wasn't even for him, we just wanted to get out of there quickly) and started going on about his woes at the restaurant. Its was the most offensive treatment I've ever received at a restaurant. I honestly can't believe that happened and don't understand how they hired someone so rude and obviously unstable. I called to let the managment know and the girl who answered knew who I was talking about before I even described him, which must mean this is an ongoing problem that they have done nothing about. I wanted to like you, Handlebar. But when I go into a restaurant, I don't expect to be harassed by the staff. It was scary and uncalled for. Spend your money elsewhere fellow yelpers. Avoid this place unless you want to be chased down the street by your waiter.

The Handlebar has been one of my longest standing Chicago restaurant relationship. I used to come here when I was a student and spending $6 on a beer was a big deal and I would splurge on getting the premium side (smoked gouda mac and cheese, arguably, the best mac and cheese I've had in a restaurant in Chicago) and leave so full of fried pickles (SKEWERS PEOPLE, not coins!) and the buffalo "chicken" wrap that I would have to take a nap on a lawn before I rode back home.  It's a great place to go to if you're vegetarian and are looking for a place that will also please meat eaters. Now, I come back and stick with my usual menu choices and sometimes add an order of chili cheese fries or get the Diablos if I'm feeling a little wild. The Handlebar menu hasn't changed much over the past 9 years but why change a good thing?

For someone that loves meat and doesn't really see the point in tofu I was pleasantly surprised with my meal. I had the Chicago style sandwich with a side of the gouda mac. My first few bites of the sandwich were a little bland but once I made it to the spread and seasoning it was quite tasty. The mac wasn't out of this world but it was still delicious.  It's a small space and gets really busy so the staff has to kind of move people along. I wasn't ready to go but got the feeling that they wanted my table. It's best if you plan to get in and get out.

Nice place..but very small and cramped. We stopped by on Sunday afternoon. There was a 20-30 minute wait, which is not too bad but there were 3 other parties waiting and there is literally nowhere to stand and not be in the way. We finally got a table which was very small and cramped. We ordered the fried pickles and fries as an appetizer and two entrees: fried avocado tacos and sambal tofu. The food was good, the tacos were a bit messy to eat. It is very important to note that it's very noisy in the restaurant. Overall a good experience.

Handlebar is hands-down one of my favorite restaurants to dine-in or order-out. They have an awesome patio to enjoy drinks with friends when the weather calls for it, and the inside of the restaurant has a super chill vibe even though it tends to get quite crowded. Great service, always super quick delivery, and in my opinion, some of the best vegan food in Chicago - even my carnivorous buds love this place!

Small place with great food, but really loud music.  Ambiance: As I said, really loud music. Small place, so it can get packed quick! Casual dress. Very hipster vibe. Depending on the time you go there is pretty easy parking on North Ave both in front and across the street.  Food: Great variety of options for vegetarian, vegan and carnivores!  Brunch- Country Fried Portobella, Pepita Scramble, Chocolate Pretzel Peanut Butter Cake Country Fried Portobella: We did both the blackened tofu and the fried egg. If you had to choose, I'd say the fried egg. Portions are large and the dish is a bit on the heavy side. I'd recommend sharing or saving half for later. Really tasty and if you are not a fan of mushrooms, it's still worth trying. The breading and the gravy have a lot of flavor that it masks that weird taste of mushrooms (I personally do not like mushrooms, but still enjoyed the dish).  Pepita Scramble: I got it with the eggs. Perfect amount to keep you full throughout the day. I ordered it with the mixed greens (made it lighter) I'm not sure if they were onions or poblanos, but topped on the scramble was something crispy that added great flavor and texture to the softness of the scramble.  Chocolate Pretzel Peanut Butter Cake: SUPER addicting so be careful. That peanut butter frosting MMMMM. I don't believe it's vegan, but I highly recommend if you have a sweet tooth.  Price point is pretty good. For two dishes, dessert, a chai and coffe it cost about $40 total without tip.  As far as drinks go, I ordered a Chai and it was alright, personally isn't one I'd order again unless I was craving one. It didn't have as much flavor as some other ones I've had.  Service: Was alright, kind of slow, But the food came out pretty fast.  Overall highly recommend and would be back!

Cool place, good Saturday brunch food but the music got so loud it made it near to impossible to hear across even a small table. Glad we went but the volume would make me think twice about going back.

Landed in Chicago super late and when getting our rental car it was even later and we were even hungrier than we were when we started! So I did what I normally do, and do out of habit and more so hobby; I got on yelp and searched. I'm gluten and dairy free so my selection is always annoyingly limited and I have to be super picky and snobbish about what I eat. Goes with the territory kind of I guess. This local joint came up and had raving reviews so I pulled up there menu, and I was drooling over my phone as I read off what I wanted to order. We got the nachos, chili cheese fries, a couple other snack type things. We did get them to go but they were super fast which is always nice when you're starving. If only I lived locally I would be a regular at Handlebar! Keep up the good work here and thank you for serving and offering gluten free and vegan or dairy free options for people like myself who miss these type of food items!!
Delicious vegetarian food in a lively casual environment. Be prepared for the noise. Food is excellent.

You would never guess by the look of the place that it had an amazing kitchen. The food they crank out is fantastic, delicious and would fool me on being often vegan and vegetarian. The wraps and breakfasts are where it's at. Metal, beer and a decent vegan breakfast, what's not to love?

Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! It's not super huge, but in the summer they do have a patio. It's  dimly lit with a dive feel to it, so it's always super chill inside. I have been here well over 10 times, yet never for brunch. I have tried almost everything though on the dinner menu (except fish dishes, which are only a few). And what's great is that almost every dish can be vegan, all you have to do is ask your server, they're all amazing. The chili Mac attack or fried Alvarado tacos are definitely my two favorite dinner entrees.   The black bean tostada are by far the best appetizer, the tostada is just magical and melts in your mouth.  But the best reason to come is the dessert, the fried pies are just to die for. Traditionally the filling is PB&J, which is my favorite, but sometimes the filling varies with season. It comes with two little crispy outside, warm decadent gooey inside just flowing with liquid gold aka the PB&J. DEF get a scoop of soy ice cream with it, the combination of altering bites of hot and cold dessert will indefinitely cause a mouth oragy within.

Stopped in here when looking for a good Bloody Mary. Originally we were looking for something else but the other place was closed.  Their bloody mary was pretty good, it wasn't my favorite but it was definitely solid, I wouldn't downgrade it by any means.  I didn't give the fare a chance as I'm not a vegan dude but I'm sure it was pretty good as the place was packed.

I've only had one experience here, and that on a Friday morning, but that experience was great so I'm on board.  Whenever I go to Chicago, I usually wind up in Wicker Park, and after a night out nothing sounded quite so good as some delicious breakfast. I'd read up about Handlebar being veg-friendly, so my partner and I headed over to check it out. Casual bar/restaurant, spacious, easy to get to. The menu had a good variety of options, but breakfast and otherwise, and the food that came out was delicious. I had the vegan pepitas scramble with spuds and toast, and it was exactly the kind of quality content I was looking for.  Thank you, Handlebar! I'll be back again.
Excellent veggie friendly spot! I love the breakfast burrito and fried avocado tacos!

So, I have a fun group of good friends that I game with.  And because they are literally some of the best and nicest people around, they took me out to dinner here just after the holidays.  Sure, I run the games, but them taking me here (and even giving me gifts) was way too nice.  I love these guys. Anyway, on to the review of Handlebar.  Getting there sucked.  Not because of the venue, but just because Chicago traffic.  But the point is that only half of our party was there on time and the rest of us were late.  Some venues would say "suck it" and just kick our asses out or make us wait for hours.  Not Handlebar.  Despite the fact that they were pretty busy, they actually managed to fit us back in with only like a 10 minute delay.  Amazing. Many people think that Handlebar is all vegetarian.  Nope!  Yeah, there are a lot of really awesome veggie recipes on the menu, but there are also meaty dishes.  Don't worry, you'll be okay. Beer selections is good.  Definitely better than average.  Food selection is also quite good, with a combination of comfort food, classics and somewhat fancier stuff.  I can pretty much guarantee that you'll find something you like here.  Maybe not 10 things, but probably more than one. The serving staff were a little standoffish (autocorrect says that's a word) - nice enough but a little hipster doofus for me.  The whole place is a bit hipster, but not necessarily in a bad way.  Anyway, Handlebar is a great place, and even better if you have awesome people to share it with.  Thanks guys!!
Great food. Great service. Vibe is great. Music was rock'n the joint. Every time I'm there it's busy. Just make sure if you want to get a dinner. Get there early.

I was visiting Chicago last week from California and stumbled across this place on Yelp and it was so close to where we were staying. We came here for breakfast/brunch on Saturday and they quoted us a 30 minute wait, however, I saw people that came after us who got seated before us, not sure why. Anyways, we were seated in a timely manner and ordered the breakfast burrito with seitan chorizo and it was not what I was expecting. I would say it was just ok. We came back here for dinner and I ordered the chili mac attack and my boyfriend ordered the chili cheese fries. The mac attack was delicious and I highly recommend it, the vegan chili cheese fries were good too, they taste just like regular chili cheese fries. The service was better in the evening but I can't complain either way. I'm not vegetarian but they have a great variety of vegetarian and vegan choices.

My boyfriend and I ordered carry out this evening and we were pleasantly surprised. We shared the Fried Pickles and had the Ground Nut Stew and Buffalo Chicken Wrap. Everything was amazing. I really loved the flavor of the Ground Nut Stew it reminded me of some of my favorite Thai Curry dishes. We will be back!
When I was dating a vegan, I found it very hard to find restaurants where we both really enjoyed eating. This place was a god sent!

As vegans living in Chicago, it can be difficult to find a decent place for brunch. The Handlebar is one of our standbys. They offer unique weekly specials, delicious mixed drinks and beer, high quality teas and their ingredients always taste fresh. Not only do we love their brunch, but it's a great place to bring out of town visitors for dinner. The patio is especially nice during the warmer months, and the dining area has a friendly, cozy atmosphere. Even our non-vegetarian friends have loved this spot. Favorite brunch item: Country Fried Portabella. Favorite entree: Sambal Tofu Favorite sandwich: Chicago Style Tofu Favorite salad: All Green Salad (This can be made vegan by substituting the dressing! I usually get vegan ranch.) Definitely give this place a try!

Oh how I do love Handlebar!!! This place is amazing for vegetarians and amazing for super carnivores!  Please stop by and make sure you try everything! Lol- I am sounding like a fan girl, but I've been here three times and it's always been a delight.  I only wish that they had twice the space and more locations!   Try the nachos, the mac n cheese chili and the samosas!
Love this place! The chicken wrap and mac and cheese are a couple of my favorites. Good for brunch, too.

I'm vegan & after attending a company party at nearby Whirlyball where meat, dairy, and more meat was served, I opted to drop by for some real food. Two of my coworkers really like this place & I'm so happy I stopped by!  It's a bar with dim lighting, cool ambiance & the food even better. Got the Sambal Tofu & it's hands down THE BEST BOWL I've ever had in my life. Finally! A restaurant that understands my love for veggies! Came loaded with greens that made up at least 50% of the bowl; I hate it when restaurants list healthy greens on the menu to be "hip" when starches (even if it's organic brown rice) make up a bulk of the item. A few issues though: the menu didn't list that the tofu is deep fried (no biggie), it came drowning in sauce (it was more like a soup bowl), & it was ridiculously salty. Loved that it was also sour & spicy, but after a few bites, I drank an entire glass of water & had to send it back. The chef made it again with the sauces on the side (3 shot glasses: peanut, sambal, & broccoli sauce--if he did use that much sauce in the dish, it's no wonder it came swimming in liquid!). Phenomenal & hence the rating.

Delicious! Great place to grab a drink and a vegetarian friendly meal with a friend.  We got the samosas, the chili mac and the green monster sandwich. All three were yummy! Felt reasonable priced as well

I come here all the time. I haven't tried too many things on the menu because I have my favorites! The fried pickles, the black bean tostadas, the nachos (yummy, it's a lot too). I tried the shrimp and grits once, something was off there, it just wasn't fresh. The smoked Gouda mac and cheese is just not flavorful. I didn't care at all for the chik'n wrap. Either way, this is my favorite night time vegan spot after most other places close.

The food is definitely great here especially the vegan options. The alcohol selection and quality drinks is also pretty good. A pretty big hipster hang out I guess, I wish they would tone the hipster thing down a little bit.

Perfect hangover brunch! Came here with some friends for hangover brunch, and left happy. Much to my dismay they didn't have pancakes on their menu. But their two eggs over medium were salted delightfully, toast was yummy, and breakfast potatoes were on point. I also go hot chocolate which really hit the spot and wasn't too heavy. When everyone was fat and happy we got our check and was again pleasantly surprised. Very reasonable. I'd definitely come back here again and again. But probably not the place to take your grandma.

Very neat little place, with absolutely amazing food. Gets a little crowded, but that's okay, they're obviously super good. Got the fried pickles and the nachos, wanted to get more, but that filled us up quick. Will be back again, I will actually fly to Chicago from Michigan just to come here

Yummy!!! We ended up at Handlebar for Brunch. The bloody hammer was amazing as well as the hibiscus tea. We ordered the chimichanga (no eggs) and black bean tostadas. Loved the chimichanga. I was not a big fan of the black bean tostadas (we're bit bland and the base was too soft). Would go again to try rest of the menu. As always the service was A++ Visit #2 - amazing experience. We had fried avocado taco and Cincinnati 5-way (vegan chili with noodles). Amazing food and service A+++ as always.
So many vegan options! There's even a cocktail that comes with a peanut chew. Friendly staff and no wait. The Sunday night taco special is a great deal.

Fried pickles and vegan ranch; the best vegan sloppy joe i have ever had....seriously.  That's not an exaggeration.  I am honestly not sure if I even need to write any more in this review - but I will because, hey, I have a platform. I've always been a Northside guy when i visit Chicago, and the Chi Diner has always been my go-to for veggie food in the Windy City.  Year ago though, someone told me to head to Wicker Park and check out the Handlebar.  Man, am I glad I did.  it's become a staple of my Chicago eating trips. The menu is phenomenal - great vegan comfort food (see the aforementioned fried pickles and sloppy joes); however there's also a great assortment of salads and other veggies. I'm not a drinker but the bar looks stocked with micros.  Expect a littler hipster standoffishness from the staff, but hey, that's part of the charm.

They have some things on the menu that I can't get enough of like the buffalo chicken sandwich, biscuits/gravy and cheese sauce. Some of the other stuff is kinda boring or overpriced for what you're getting. I've never noticed anything new on the menu. But they have vegan brunch which I feel like is kinda hard to find. I've taken omnis here and they generally enjoyed what they've gotten.  The backyard seating is where its at on a nice day. I have some nice memories here. Good times.
If you're a vegan and you need a safe place to eat at ... check this place out! I love this place!!  VEGAN TAKEOVER     teespring.com/i-am-vegan…

Was so excited about going to this vegetarian restaurant. But, not impressed with my sandwich - the sloppy joe. Supposed to be BBQ sauce, but was not any kind of BBQ sauce U've ever had. Not tangy, not vinegar or mustard based-nothing but Tabasco. It was so spicy my mouth was on fire. Had the sesame broccoli  as my side. It was cooked well, but not very flavorful. The fried pickles were good. Service was average.

One of my favorite bars in Chicago. Excellent selection of craft beers and interesting cocktails, as well as a full menu of everything from salads to sandwiches to late night snacks and desserts. Almost anything on the menu can be made vegan, and their kitchen is open late. An ideal spot for late night food in Wicker Park.  I appreciate that their full menu is available even after midnight on a Saturday. Most people associate bar food with fried greasy unhealthy options (which are totally available here as well), but it was refreshing to be able to eat a proper meal after starving all day at a music festival. I had the Chicago Style tofu sandwich, which was fantastic. Flavorful basil pesto tofu with fresh veggies on a delicious ciabatta bread. My friends ordered various vegan entrees which all looked delicious. Service is very fast and friendly.

SMOKING OK back yard, hence 2/5/  Otherwise 3/5. Enjoyed the back yard ambiance minus the smoking area....WTF having a smoking area at the restaurant now...could not breath. Nachos were good. Avocado taco, blah. Grilled tuna fish sandwich, not good at all. Other dishes at the OK level, perhaps a 2/5.

My boyfriend and I make the trip from rockford just for this food, at least a couple times a month. Really awesome vegetarian and vegan options, and it's the one place that I actually enjoy the vegan cheese (my bf is vegan, I'm obsessed with cheese) Had one weird experience here with a hostess, but other than that, everything is great. Good service, good people, good food, good atmosphere.

This bar is actually very cool. They have a great inside and a kick ass patio to chill and drink on. The margaritas are kick ass and the beer list is fairly decent. They have an awesome Bloody Mary if you come in the mornings, don't miss the fried pickle.  This is one of the havens I bring my vegetarian friends to, almost every dish can be made so. They also will satisfy the pescatarian with their fish taco's. The breakfast burrito is on point!! This is the 25th time I've eaten here in the 3 years I have lived here so this is my ode to them. Service 60% sucks; sometimes it's great. It usually is slow and I have had multiple times my order takes forever or is wrong. Once they actually forgot to put my food order and it took 30 min to realize it. Other than that, a solid 4 stars.
I've had nearly everything on their menu, both vegan/vegetarian and the fish dishes and I've never been disappointed. If you don't like loud restaurants, don't eat here.

The Handlebar is a great spot with killer food and drink options. It's a vegetarian restaurant, and though I am certainly not a vegetarian,  I leave very full and satisfied every time. A few menu standouts and the nachos and the chili Mac. Both are giant portions, plenty of leftovers for next day munchies! They also have a great patio AND Bloody Mary, which everyone knows equals bonus points in my book. Their bloody is topped with a fried pickle!
Underrated brunch spot with a unique vibe. Dishes are fresh and as a non-vegetarian, definitely not missing any of the meat. We came for the bloodies but stayed for the breakfast d
Great hang over food. Good location. Just do not be in a rush- the service is VERY slow.

This is one of the best restaurants in this neighborhood! The menu is huge and there's an option for everyone. Amazing vegan dishes that taste incredible. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Prices are on point and the portions could easily feed 2. Generous side portions that come with the entree! The collard greens and fried portobello are my favorite. They have po boys, vegan breakfast burritos, and great comfort food.

Let me start by saying, I like the food at Handlebar. That said, my girlfriend and I are here and while they have 3 tables that sit 4 people, they won't sit us because their tables are for 4 people...hmmm. I understand policies, BUT their tables for 4, are actually 2 small tables that you can pull apart a few inches and make, oh I don't know, 2 smaller tables, and then you DON'T have to make your multiple parties of two wait 15-20 mins. I asked the hostess if they could accommodate us, so we didn't have to wait. It's a Monday afternoon, not a weekend night, so I was 99% sure we would be done eating before they filled the open tables. However, she didn't care to provide good customer service. I'm giving it 3 stars only because I do like the menu, being vegan. But if I'd give them 1 star for their customer service and ridiculous seating "policy". To the restaurant Mgmt and / or owner, you should train your people to accommodate and sit your customers as soon as they can, and to think on their feet. That's the way the world works.

We came for dinner on a Friday night. Everything was delicious.  We got the chili cheese fries, buffalo chicken wrap, and sloppy joes.  The sides of garlic mashed potatoes and smoked gouda mac were also amazing.  Service was prompt and friendly.  If you like vegetarian or vegan food, definitely come here.

My coworkers chose this place for a team outing. We sat in the back patio area. The place was cute, the food was good with lots of options, and the service was good. I don't live close to this place but I hope I'll get to go back at some point.
Brooklyn atmos - groovy hipster place with the Smiths and the Cure posters to boot. I had the paprika shrimp with black beans and spinach - tasty but greasy.

A decent selection of vegetarian and vegan fare, as well as a spectacular playlist of heavy metal. Draft beers are reasonably priced and diverse. Try the Black Bean Maduro and definitely do not miss out on the Smoked Gouda Mac premium side. A perfect spot for a casual meal with friends on the weekend.
Food was excellent and had plenty of good vegetarian options. We sat outside on the patio and had great service.  Will be back.
Came here for bunch on a Sunday. It was fantastic! Great service and great food, I ordered the French toast. I will definitely be back soon. :)

The vegan fried avocado tacos (which they will make with corn tortillas, if you ask) are absolutely delicious and sitting on the patio is delightful.  I myself don't enjoy the atmosphere inside the restaurant quite as much--it's somewhat hectic and noisy--but I keep coming back for the tacos.

Huge waste of money. We didn't know anything about this spot except for the Yelp reviews which were pretty good, I have no clue why. Service was stupidly slow, food was incredibly bland, and on top of it all my boyfriend got sick on the way home probably because his omelette was sitting on the counter for so long!! It took an hour for us to get two egg dishes. I have no idea why. Also the place is so small you have to stick your butt in other people's tables to squeeze out of the booth and there are weird steps. Will never go back or recommend to anyone else, ever. There are sooooo many other better places for vegetarians and vegans! Chicago diner, victory's banner, native foods just to name a few!
Handlebar never disappoints! The food is always solid and the staff is always friendly and efficient. Nachos, buffalo chicken wrap, mac and cheese, and tofu sambal are some favorites.

Great vegetarian comfort food. Recommend the Green Meanie sandwich -- avocado, goat cheese spinach tomatoes sprouts and honey mustard. The fries are good too, and plentiful. And received attentive service in mid afternoon. Which can be a challenge. Coffee is good too.

I really loved the Handlebar!  They're awesome and the vegan options are great!  When I realized they had a patio, I couldn't wait to dine there with my pup.  I show up and was promptly turned  away.  No dogs allowed.  Really??!!  Why even have a patio then??   I"ll go back for late night eats occasionally, but I'd come here so much more if I could bring my dog friend.

My husband and I went here for brunch. As vegetarians, we were excited they had seitan options instead of just beans or tofu He got a vegan breakfast burrito. This was ok, it needed more flavor and I've had way better breakfast burritos I got the Diablo with seitan and tofu. I was in heaven at first bite! This dish was amazing, it had a chipotle sauce that was so flavorful and it all blended in so well.  Both the dishes also came with black beans, that were really tasty! We also got their mimosas, they were on the weaker end but hey..it was $4. Coming back here to explore their dinner menu next!

Twice a year I come here for brunch and twice a year I leave happy, full, and slightly tipsy. Not too shabby! The vibe inside reminds me of my fave E Village dive bars from NYC and the outdoor patio feels like you're in your own backyard (in a good way). One of the best features here is their restrictive diet friendly eats. Sure, us fat kids might loathe the loss of bacon, but the alternatives offered are good enough that you forget about everyones favorite meat candy. I usually stick with the breakfast burrito (if I'm super hungover) or the pepita scramble (mildly hungover), both equally good options. Snag a tasty bloody or one of their specialty drinks (there was a grape moonshine cocktail last visit that knocked my boots off for $6), and kick that hangover into the past! See ya next week, Handlebar!

My fiancé and I payed a visit here while in Chicago , phenomenal place that equally meets their food. I would definitely recommend this place to enjoy a nice brew and meal. I would recommend asking for Thomas , you won't be disappointed.
Great little place with delicious food and huge portions. Lovely outdoor seating patio in the back. Great vegetarian and vegan options. Absolutely delicious!

I ordered the Handlebar Omelet. The smoked gouda was good, but the pears were not...I ate around them. The breakfast potatoes were very, very dry and bland - no seasoning, no onions, nothing. Disappointing. My friend had the Everything Green salad, which she said was pretty good. Definitely not worth a return visit.

I am not vegetarian or vegan but my friends are. They liked the food but it was pricey (but I didn't expect cheaper because of the neighborhood being gentrified). Another friend that dined with us did not like the mac n cheese chili bowl that he got. The smoked Gouda mac n cheese was not that great. On top of this, customer service was poor. They gave up our table and made us sit awkwardly when we finally got a table. The waiter did take one item off of the bill because we didn't like it. So I give them 2 stars. I think I am bigger fan of Chicago Diner.

At this point, you'd think I was a local given how often I end up at Handlebar while visiting Chicago. I'm not a vegan (though very recently I was), but it ends up being the perfect brunch destination for large groups. Don't eat meat? You're covered. Gluten free? You'll find something. Eat meat, but willing to go a single meal with just eggs instead of flesh foods? You'll find some delicious options. Add to that some tasty brunch drinks and reasonable prices, and you've concocted a recipe for success. Vibe wise, if you're not comfortable with secondhand skinny jeans, lots of tattoos + facial hair, and countless diners sporting band t-shirts, then it may not be your place.

Came here last night and I really enjoyed the environment. My friends and I sat outside and the character of the outside seating is a fairytale. There are plants everywhere and exposed brick. I experienced a relaxing vibe even tho the restaurant was crowded with people.  However, what I really didn't enjoy was our server. He barely came around and when he did, he made no effort to be engaging. When he would talk to us, he would look the other direction than where my face was. I thought that was odd because it made me feel like he was worried about other things rather than getting my order correct.  The cherry on top was how he handled the bill. My friends forgot to stop by an ATM because they couldn't find parking so we had to split the check. I get that we should have told him at the beginning but as a customer we simply did not know. Not only did he refuse to split the check for us he was straight up rude right to our faces. I don't care how cool your bar is, being kind and understanding is just the human thing to do. Not to treat guests like crap for simply not stopping by an ATM. Needless to say this was my last time at handlebar until they get their staff in order.

Ordered a vegan burrito to go...had better. My first time here thought it would've been a lot better but it was first thing in the morning. I'll give them a second chance but definitely ordering something else $9 for a burrito and it was just ok...

WOW! I'm totally in love! Amazing food and fantastic drinks. I might actually start to like Chicago. This place is on it. The vegan dishes got me here...everything else stole my heart and might get to keep it with my blessing! Black bean tostadas for appetizers, Reyka Mule for drinks, and the Black Bean Madura for my entrée. Heaven came to earth! Thank you! ... And the service was excellent!
I'm definitely a vegetarian that goes nuts for this place.  The food is fresh and the drinks are great. I love the ambiance of the location.

This place gets 5 stars all the way! The Chicago Insider, Danny Wurst told me about it.  The buffalo cauliflower and the vegan nachos were on point.  Good music and the service made me feel right at home.  Will be back next time I am in Chicago.

Had brunch here yesterday.  This is a hipster vegan restaurant. We sat outside and my wife and I, not being vegan had shrimp and grits.  Our son had biscuits and gravy. The food was good but the service was slow.

Worse customer service I have EVER experienced!!! My girlfriend kindly asked the manager if we could switch tables to get more fresh air and he was so disrespectful and I could not listen to anyone speak to her the way he did. The patio was completely empty and he was so upset that we wanted to move. The food did not make up for this situation. There are far better places to go in the city to enjoy good food, a chill bar, and a pleasant atmosphere. Everything we ate was so dry and lacked any kind of unique flavor. I will never be coming back here ever.
Sam bal tofu is suuuuuuper spicy and salty, had to order a side of brown rice, which is super small and cost &3, this place is overrated and overpriced. Not coming back.

Don't ever come here the manager is the biggest dick that I have ever met. It was a completely empty patio and he was so upset that we chose a table that was not to his liking. He was so disrespectful and was so rude to the patrons dining. We respectfully asked him if we could move and he bluntly told us no because that's just the way it is. Fuck this place and the manager here. I wish I could rate a negative star.

Delicious vegetarian and vegan food, prepared in all the ways non-veggie folk love and expect. What's not to love? Fun, divey feel to the place, pretty affordable (probably $9-$12 for a plate of food). My wife and I make it a habit to stop by a few times a year when we are nearby.

Came here for lunch on a Sunday around 1 pm.  The brunch crowd was in full effect and tables were scarce.  We didn't have a reservation so we were offered seats at the bar.  We took them.  We also took in the scenery, the sights and sounds.  Dark walls covered in random art, records, posters, etc.  Heavy metal playing and servers with intense beards, black nail polish and worn our band t-shirts.  So basically the REALLY cool kids. There was a lot of energy here...there is also a patio aside from the packed dining room, so it was clear they were real busy....that being said we were at the bar, which meant constant face time with some level of staff...bartenders, servers, bussers - but no one spoke to us...perhaps it was our lululemon get ups or the mainstream highlights in our hair? We were eventually handed menus and when we were finally asked for our orders we ordered entrees, but it was only 1 pm and they don't serve entrees until 3.  Ok, our bad.  But then we waited another 20 minutes to be approached for our orders again, all while watching staff actively ignore us.  We were officially HANGRY.   We both went with the Mean Greenie in the interest of speed - it was a veggie sandwich with a humongous order of fries.  It was fine.  We were hungry and anything would have worked. I'm sure we didn't make the best choice as there were breakfast items that sounded very good but we were there for lunch and we were too early for the food we wanted.   All this being said, obviously this place is a local hit, if done right.  We didn't know what to expect and our experience was disappointing.  If you come here, just do everything opposite of what we did.
Love it! Great array of vegetarian entrees and good drinks to boot! The chili mac and sloppy joe are especially outstanding.

The weather was nice enough to sit out on the patio and it was great! The bloody mary's were good, and my vegan friends got pearl onion on their garnish instead of the cheese, which I gladly ate. The fried pickles with vegan sauce were good, and not too greasy. The Everything Green salad was tasty, and it was only $2 more to add blackened tofu.

We were greeted by a snobby hostess who acted super confused when we said we were meeting our group in the beer garden. They told they couldn't seat a table of 6, so we sat in the sitting area for 20 minutes before we had to ask how to order. When we asked, the rude waiter told us we had to order inside. When our friends asked to close their tab, they told us the waitress was "pretty busy" and had to wait another 20 minutes. I understand that I might not know how a particular restaurant works, but you don't have be total pretentious dicks about it. I wish I knew how the things on the menu were.

I came here with my boyfriend during the weekday for lunch. They have vegan and non vegan dishes. We ordered the fried pickles- which were tasty with their house made vegan ranch. I ordered the sloppy joe with mashed potatoes (which were both vegan) and thought it was very very good. My boyfriend ordered the Chicago style tofu (vegan)- it was alright. I wasn't sure what it was supposed to replicate- but it reminded me of Corner Bakery's chicken pesto. Because we came for lunch it wasn't too busy, but I can see it getting very busy for dinner. It is a pretty small restaurant. But they do claim that the house rules is that they get to ask you to leave if there is a line- so just be courteous of others who are waiting to eat.
Truly Awesome food! Get the Chimichanga if you're really Hungary... It's delicious. Pair that with a Bloody Mary (topped with a fried pickle) and you're golden.

So many awesome options for vegans!  I love this place! They also went so far out of their way to make sure none of our food was contaminated with tree nuts, as our son has a horrible allergy. They even prepared new vegan cheese without the cashews just for us. Everything we ate here was amazing!

Ok first of all, the nachos are for sure dope. Seriously, I wish I was eating them right now. The GF and I have had a handful of their menu items and they've all been mad decent. Except the the vegetarian biscuits and gravy. It was like a primordial looking bowl of goop with a hockey puck of a biscuit in the middle. For sure not going to order that again. Handlebar definitely dropped the ball on that one. But I'm not going to judge them off of that one dish. Great place to grab some tasty and filling vegetarian food! For sure going there again.

Late night vegan eats in a dark & dreamy bar? Sign me the hell up! It's been over a week, but I'm still fantasizing about Handlebar's Buffalo "Chicken" wrap. And maybe the fried pickles, too. If it seems like they are serving up basic comfort food for vegans & omnivores alike, you're a little off the mark, though. I mean it's anything but basic! My wrap was bursting with fresh ingredients and the "chicken" is unlike any fake meat I've ever had before, with phenomenal texture and taste. Because I'm a gal who always has "hot sauce in my bag," I poured on extra and was possibly blind and deaf to everything going on around me so that I could concentrate on devouring this sandwich. Yeah, I'm an animal. Fried pickles are spears and I'm more of a fan of chips, but no matter, really, when the batter is this good and the dipping sauce will have you sopping up the remains in the ramekin.  Handlebar would be the perfect place for me if it existed in New Orleans because I could totally be able to throw down and eat like a champ among my meat-eating friends and boyfriend. For now, I'm just planning on staying walking distance next time I'm in Chicago.

Hubby and I got in a nice date night here before hitting our dance club.  I got myself a good cider (some choices, not heaps, but decent) and we split some sides.  Their guac is nice and flavorful without being too hot.  But hands down my favorite was the smoked gouda mac and cheese.  YUM. Service was nice.  Atmosphere lovely.  If you are in Wicker Park and want plenty of vegetarian options that are well made but not fussy.... this is the place.

the food is super good- the service sucks. We went for brunch yesterday for Mother's Day, they weren't super busy but it took a while for the hostess to figure out if we could sit or not (there were many open tables). After that, the waiter seemed kind of impatient with my mom's boyfriend who was trying to navigate the menu. No biggy though, but then it took forever for the wait staff to do anything. We waited forever for our bill after asking three different people which was kind of annoying... BUT the food is super good- and I really like restaurants that can cater to anyone (vegans, vegetarians, eaters of the flesh, etc) and the patio was cute- plus the drinks were on point. so four stars for  you- but get your staff together.

Went here for a date because she is a vegetarian. It's rated pretty high, so I figured I'd try it out. Plus, she looked at the menu beforehand and she really liked what she saw. She got the buffalo chicken sandwich and really liked it. Get the chili fries! They did do a really good job with whatever substitute they used for the chili.  I got the tacos which were good, but left me still hungry. With that said, I would give 5 stars if they offered a few non-vegetarian dishes. But I think vegetarians would be very happy with this place though.

I wanted to love this place. I really did. But it was disappointing. And their menu had such promise. So many options that sounded amazingly delicious - but when the food arrived at the table, it was mostly meh. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich (made of tofu) and it was okay, but nothing special. The hot sauce was missing the OOMPF you expect. Although, the texture was right, especially considering it wasn't real chicken. So I guess I can't complain too much. Some vegan/vegetarian places that offer Buffalo Chicken Sandwiches (out of tofu) get the texture completely off. The only reason I give this place 3 stars was the mac and cheese I ordered as a side. I honestly probably would've been happier if I had ordered it as my entree. It was so creamy and delicious. It was everything a baked mac and cheese should be.

The food was good, and they had multiple vegan options which is always awesome. We tried the deep fried pickles and they were okay, I didn't realize they were going to be spears so they were kinda hard warm pickles with some breading around them, not really my favorite. But our entrees were yummy, my boyfriend got the chicago style tofu sandwich which was good and kinda funky and I got the everything green salad which was seriously good. There are so many good sounding things on the menu, so I am def going to be coming back very soon.
We came for brunch on a Sunday and hangout in the back outside. Michelada was tasty and perfect spice level. Good spot to sit outside for brunch.

I like visiting news places. Parking on the street was free. Winning! Good service and super low key crowd. I had the green meanie sandwich and green beans. The sandwich was good and good for me. My coworkers broccoli was much better though. We started with chili cheese fries!!! It's definitely worth a try. I'll be back. Fewer stars because there's no real meat in the place.

Great food and drinks. Very vegan friendly.  When coming to Chicago, it's become a tradition that I check out Handlebar. I love that most of the menu can be made vegan and they have an array of interesting drink options.  The vegan sloppy joe was very good. I, for one, don't care for messy meals, but this one holds true to its name... It was very delicious though. My only other complaint is that you can't get a pretzel roll with it if you order vegan! The Black Bean Maduro is another excellent choice. It's a very savory dish that will fill you up. In general, portion sizes are very generous here.  Service has always been pleasant at Handlebar. On my last visit, we came here for dinner and our meals were done in less than 10 minutes. That is super fast! The only other minor complaint I have is that this place is kind of cramped, especially on a busy night. It's best for a party of two or smaller. I will still be coming back, though!

Everything here was so good. I had the avocado tacos which were fantastic. 8/10 simply because there were not many toppings. My friend ordered the vegan "sloppy joe" and even as a meat eater, he loved it and finished the whole dish!  4/5 because it was a bit dark/loud/crammed.

Had the chili Mac twice, loved it both times. I'm not a vegetarian but I wasn't mad that there wasn't meat in it, the flavors were good. Veryyyyyy hipster, but that's pretty much expected in the area. Drinks were good too. Would definitely go back.

We love going here. Foods awesome! My meat eating boyfriend even loves the food here. This place serves the best fried pickles in the city! And their vegan chili is so bomb. The ambiance is chill and relaxed. I'm only taking off one star because of the service. Once a server tried to charge us for four drinks each instead of three bc he thought we were too drunk. No way that was an accident because we were one of his three tables he served the entire time. The next time we came back it was the same server and he forgot we were even there... He took our order and Someone else served us the rest of the time because we flagged him down. Will come back.
First of all the parking is a nightmare and then.the long wait. Our server Tom.was phenomenonal and very patient. We enjoyed the appetizers more than the entrees.

Having just arrived in Chicago, my BF and I walked down the street to grab some lunch and bumped into the eclectic awesomeness that is Handlebar.  It was quite crowded, so we decided to sit outdoors even though this took place during the summer when it was super hot. Inside, band posters and crazy artwork plastered the walls, and in addition to the inside and patio seats there were some stools at the bar. Both of us were a bit skeptical as to how delicious vegan food could be, but when our sandwiches and mac and cheese came, we sang a different tune.  My "green meanie" was thoroughly satisfying.  Our table was also quite close to our neighbors' and we ended up eavesdropping on their conversation about the logistics of touring as a band.  Very hipster place, and very cool.

Great food and cool drink selection. Very nice patio space and cool local artwork displayed for purchase! The service is a hit or miss. Some of the servers take the punk attitude a little too seriously. I live in the neighborhood now and go a pretty good bit but because of the service, after I move I don't think it will be a place I travel to dine/ drink.

I love this place! Their veg options are wonderful! And the flavors that they combine in their food is delicious. I love the Chicago Style Tofu. And the side of broccoli is out of this world! Also their macaroni is delicious. Sometimes service can be a little slow here and the staff is the typical hipster crowd. But the food makes up for it. It's a go to for everyone!

LOVE this place. Lost count of how many times I've eaten here. Their food is always spot on flavorful and not over priced. Portions are very generous. Me and my boyfriend usually get to go orders late at night and they never fail to make the food great. Would recommend the fried avocado tacos, the vegan nachos, fried pickles, and sambal tofu.

The vibe was too hipster-ish for me.  Though I must go back since the food was delicious.  I can't remember what the name of the dish was but it was on the special menu; pesto tofu on corn tortilla with tomatoes, avocados, and arugula.  It was the tastiest vegan dish I had.  Minus-ed some stars because I also ordered a vegan biscuits with gravy which was not very appetizing.  Plus, the staff members there aren't very inviting.  But I'll be compelled to go back very soon to try their other vegan dishes.

So delicious. A friend of mine always swore he would never ever eat vegetarian. We all came here and he said, begrudgingly, that it was the best biscuits and sausage gravy he's ever had. Such good food and a fun atmosphere!!

Oh my goodness I love this place and I'm a gal who usually needs meat in her food! Haha. Every item we got was delicious. I didn't have my meat that night but dang my meal was so good. The sambal tofu was full of flavor and I loved that it was loaded with collard greens which is my favorite leafy greens. The sambal dressing/sauce had the right amount of peanut sauce combined and packed with a punch. The mushroom and edamame peas were all great part of my meal in a bowl. The smoked Gouda mac and cheese is another side item to get. Samosas were well done too. Only gripe was they used maraschino cherry in my old fashioned.

The place is humble and relax. Staff is very friendly. An interesting drink list. We went for brunch. We had the chimichanga and it was great. We also tried the french toast which was simple, yet tasty. Returning fot sure to try more things.

I just want to talk about that chili Mac n cheese because it was the only thing I ate and also because I miss it so much and wish we could be together again. Super genius creation, just the right amount of spicy plus tortilla chips on top (omg waaaat!? Yass! I know right?) J'reccommend! The place itself is also very cool n cozy - music is bomb, $1 PBRs on Monday if you want to feel like you're in college again.

So far one of my favorite restaurants!! I drive in from an hour away just for the fried pickles because THEY ARE THE BEST! Everything on the menu is great! Love the buffalo "chicken" wrap & fries! The management there is also super accommodating and really sweet! I recommend this place to everyone I know!!

Solid vegetarian brunch spot in Wicker Park. Came in here for brunch with my boyfriend and was pleasantly surprised to find their was no wait. It's a small place and it definitely has a sort of biker vibe to it -- rock music playing, tables tightly packed together and posters/signs scattered across the walls. Our waiter was very attentive and took time explaining food items, since their menu can be a little overwhelming to non-vegetarians (definitely more unique menu items than Native Foods, which is pretty mainstream). We opted for the diablos with the eggs and jack cheese, as well as the Pepita scamble. Both items were great choices! The diablo came with black beans, rice and corn tostadas. A bit spicy, but nothing too crazy. The pepita was sweeter, and the kale and sweet potatoes made a great combination. Nice healthy option for brunch.  Although we didn't opt for bloody marys this time around, I will say that they look badass and I'm looking forward to trying them next time. This place serves super creative dishes, and I'm excited to come back again.
