I ordered a Buffalo Chicken Wrap no ranch with side of collard greens - pretty good. The wrap was a regular white tortilla grilled filled with romaine, tomato, red onion and buffalo mock chicken. The buffalo sauce had a nice kick to it. Wrap was light and fresh tasting. The collard greens were sauteed with garlic. Still crunchy. Not over cooked. Good flavor.  This place has a nice atmosphere. Typical bar like appearance, but not as loud or dark. I could hold a conversation with someone with them still being able to hear me. They were just setting up for evening when I got there and were setting candles out on all the table. Warm and cozy here. Good for singles, dates, or friends.

Whoa - last time I was here was in 2011??  Well, nothings changed.  Still great food, still cool atmosphere, and my husbo (dedicated meat eater) loved the biz and gravy.  Bloody was fantastic so they must have dolled it up a bit.   Love this place and we'll definitely be back.

This place is awesome. When I went, I was from out of town on business. This place was a perfect mix of friendly, funky, interesting people combined with awesome vegan grub- delicious, and super drinks. I'd come back in a heartbest.  Next time I'm in chicago, I'm totally there.  Ps their vegan ranch- I could easily take a warm bath in it. ;)

2 tacos, 1 beer, and 1 shot of tequila for $10 on Sunday after 3PM. What!?!?!?!? Now I really need to go eat here. We stopped by on our way to get sushi at the place next door and just happened to stumble in to grab a drink. The bartender was plenty nice and overall had a very... "hipster vibe" going on. Beer on tap was names I've never heard of and the food looked pretty wild. When I asked him for a menu there was something that stuck out that just blew my mind. 2 tacos, a beer, and a shot for $10. That is amazing. Now its gonna force me to come back to try it. Damn you handlebar!! You haven't seen the last of me!

Handlebar, handlebar, handlebar I've been coming here a long ass time, can't believe I never reviewed it, Hun? They have MAD drink specials here, check the menu,  In the warm months there is outdoor seating, And now they have delivery, whut? Yes, I said it. If you plan on coming here on a weekend for breakfast, you may have to wait... I can't give them five stars because the vegan biscuits & gravy are not served past 3pm, Which one day really pissed me off cause I got there at 3:10pm and I was denied, and I couldn't get past it, that is what I crave! The vegan burrito is good, but nothin beats that gravy YO! Tried: Fried pickles w/vegan ranch, greens, sandwiches(not a big fan of faux meat), samosas, those tostadas(more like sopes, not like a thin tostada, but still yummy) all were good. Bloody hammer is their Bloody Mary with fried pickle, but if you don't like that, I usually get tanqueray & they charge me $1 for the pickle, you can get a high life pony for extra $1 Don't think you have to dress nice to come here, it's nothing fancy, t shirt & jeans kinda place

Had the country fried tofu with collard greens and mashed potatoes. The tofu was very crispy, and the gravy was fantastic. Tofu can be a bit boring sometimes, but it was done very well here. It was one of the specials for the day. DELICIOUS and a pretty generous portion, even though the other special (mac and cheese) was supposed to be even more food. I would definitely come here again.

Nice and cosy place to have a meal.... Not that big but this place is packed..... Had Nachos and the Sloppy Joe Sandwich both pretty good and the Chicken Wrap is really good..... Looking forward to coming back to try more items on the menu.....

Great place with great beers and food. We went on a Friday night and expected a wait. We were quoted a half hour wait for a table for two, or given the option to eat at the bar. We decided we could wait to eat, but sat at the bar for a beer while we waited. Within five minutes the host came over and said there was a table waiting. The menu is pescatarian, with several vegetarian amid vegan options. Our food came out very quickly and it was everything we had hoped for. I got the smoked gouda and cavatappi with minced veggie bacon. It didn't disappoint. When the guy at the table next to us saw the server drop it off, he ordered it as well. Highly recommended for a delicious, reasonably-priced, casual meal.

On night 2 of my "Vegan Chicago Weekend", my friend and I came here. It a restaurant that caters to pescatarian, vegetarian and vegan eaters. The menu is easy to read, the place is totally "hipster" with lots of fun posters, cards and sayings on the wall. I had the stew, the name escapes me at the moment, but it was very good. It was SO filling and such a good value for $11.00. We also shares fried pickles as an appetizer. The atmosphere is lively and the staff there make you feel right at home. I highly recommend this place to anyone, even the carnivores.

Veggie, vegans and pescitarians unite! I hate to admit that it has taken me this long to get over here!  Brunch on a Saturday is not as bad as a brunch on Sunday but was still definitely crowded.  And the crowds are right on!  The space is small and very one of a kind.  The staff is nice to have their recommendations ready to go and knowledgeable of the whole menu. I had the diablos and I would have to fight myself to get it a second time! This dish was beyond flavorful and delicious. I could eat it all day! But knowing this I have faith that just about everything is probably just as good and I want to try more.  The Diablo is  a choice of fried eggs & jack cheese or seitan chorizo & tofu, hand-pressed corn tostadas, chipotle sauce, black beans, brown rice.  I did the fried egg and cheese minus the rice.  The hand pressed corn tostadas and chipotle sauce is what made this dish spot on.  It had the right hint of heat and spice to keep you digging in for another bite. Overall the menu keeps me intrigued to try it all and I will have to do my best to come back sooner this time!

I was really excited to try this place after the great reviews. I came here with my parents because we're all either vegetarian or rarely eat meat. None of us were impressed. We waited 45 mins for a table. I got a tofu scramble which was okay, but I've had much better at Chicago diner or Karyn's, my parents said theirs was okay too, but we all agreed it wasn't worth the wait or hype.
fried pickles. biscuits and gravy.  my favorite vegan goodness in chicago.  no contest.  good vibes only.
Visiting Chicago and just had the best vegan breakfast I've ever had here! I got the pepita scramble with salsa verde and avocado and a side of the French toast. Loved it all!

This place rocks!! Handlebar offers delicious, inexpensive food with primarily vegetarian/vegan options. The fried avocado tacos are super good, and my favorite day to go is on a Sunday, when they have their $10 avocado taco (2) + tecate + tequila special. They also play movies (projected onto a wall).
Pretty sweet brunch spot ! Their breakfast Sammy s are delicious. Has a very hippy feel to it. !

I'm not a vegetarian. I don't use bicycles as my primary mode of transportation in the city... yet I love this place. I came here at the recommendation of a friend when I was trying to find a place to eat with my vegan friend that would be open past 10pm.  The set up is kind of weird-- weird steps and not exactly spacious.The service has been good and the food delicious. Their grilled cheese is amazing.  I'm writing this review mostly for myself, because I need to avoid getting green beans here. I love green beans, but here they're covered in lemon, which I do not like so much. It sucked last time, since the fall weather had chapped my lips more than usual. They obviously have plenty of bike parking out front, as well as regular parking. This is my go-to place to take any vegan/vegetarian buds, and it's really great.

What used to be a semi-regular has become one of our staples! Handlebar rocks.  Staff is always welcoming and awesome.  Outdoor seating is bomb.  Menu specials are amazing and staples keep us coming back.  Dinner Faves: Black Bean Muduro, Everything Green Salad, Fried Pickles, Chilli Cheese Fries.  Just had their Perogi special and I want it on the menu all the time please!  We recently discovered brunch (how have we not tried it sooner?) and the Chimichanga, Country Fried Portobello and Pepitas scramble are out of this world!  Breakfast Burrito is also choice!

The food is always great, sometimes the wait is a bit long, but not bad. I love coming to Wicker Park to go here, always a better and tastier option for vegetarian cuisine than places like Native Foods.

We came here for brunch on a Sunday. We were quoted a 20-30-minute wait, but it was only about 15 minutes. It was hard to narrow down the menu because everything looked so amazing. We finally decided to split two entrees that looked the most delicious to us (vegetarian friendly options for my girlfriend).  The hash dish was definitely my favorite of the two, so luckily my girlfriend agreed to eat the bulk of the veggie sandwich. The portion sizes were perfect. We usually take home leftovers after dining out, but this time we were able to finish everything on our plates while still feeling sated once we finished. We enjoyed the people watching as we ate (plenty of Wicker Park hipsters with their tattoos and man buns to ogle). The food was good, and we also liked the mustache-y decor. Why only four stars? The service wasn't the most attentive. It was a bit apathetic (though not rude at all) and very to-the-point. It really felt like they were trying to turn the table quickly so they could seat other people. The wait time had increased considerably by the time we had finished eating because the front area by the hostess desk was crowded with people. Still, I'm sure we would come back here for brunch, especially when we want brunch, but don't want to eat something unhealthy (like at The Bongo Room--those pancakes should be dessert).

I went here for brunch. Its a cool spot that has a hipster feel. Its a pretty small space but they also have an outside area. The food was pretty good. I ordered the handlebar salad and fried pickles both were tasty. My friends had their shrimp and grits, the handlebar omlet and breakfast burritos. Everyone was pleased with their meals. I would go back for sure.
Great for vegans and non-vegans. Menu has a lot of variety - the fried avocado tacos are my favorite and can be made vegan! They've got a really nice patio too.
Delish!!! Some of the best Vegan dishes in the city!!!

Good place for brunch and dinner with a group of friends that includes vegetarians/vegans and those who eat everything.  Vegan French toast and biscuits and gravy will keep me coming back.  Love this place.

This place is as hipster as it gets. I came here around brunch time and enjoyed some french toast as my friend tried the omelette.  Both were enjoyable but nothing extraordinary to write home about. I guess this place is more of a bar sort of place and I came on a weekday afternoon but the atmosphere was a little strange? Really dark and the wait service wasn't super friendly. I took a picture of one of their walls (lots of cool decorations here) and the wait service gave me a strange look.

I liked the atmosphere of the Handlebar immediately. It was fairly low-key and I liked the dim lighting. They had a pretty good selection of music looping on their sound system, and I liked the décor and punk vibe of the interior. I ordered the fried avocado tacos with brown rice. The rice is unseasoned and fairly bland, but the tacos were awesome. Personally, I think they would fare better on corn tortillas rather than flour, but the black bean spread and slaw really gave the flavor some depth. The drinks have cute names but the beer selection is pretty small. Our service was prompt and efficient.The menu has tons of items on there that sound amazing, and I wish I could have tried more. The only negative I had was that the table we were seated at was super-small. We could barely fit our plates and drinks on it, and we were encased in a pretty narrow area. I would like to try eating outside next time I stop by. Also, they only have a one-stall bathroom, so when the place is crowded, there's a line right in front of the kitchen, which is probably aggravating to the servers. Overall, though, I enjoyed myself and will definitely be returning.

The ambience of this place is pretty cool. The interior design is very unique. It is a little bit on the loud side, but not too overbearing..you will still be able to hear the people you're with. Now to the food, I was torn between the Blackened Catfish and the Sambal Tofu..in the end I order the tofu. My dish was no disappointment! The tofu came out crispy and all the leafy greens that came with the dish were perfect. The only thing that I would change is to lessen the amount of sauce not that it was bad or anything, but there was just too much sauce. My partner ordered the nachos and said it was the best nachos she's ever had. She said the only thing that she would take out is the seiten soyrizo. Other then minor changes to both our meals I would definitely come back here!

Food is good not extremely delicious, I think you will find same food at native food cafe or protein bar..  Patio setting is beautiful  People working there are extremely rude and not welcoming  Didn't take my time ordering waiter rushed out while I was speaking.. Made it seem like j was asking a lot when I asked for milk with my coffee My sister asked for the password for Internet and he made her look stupid when she asked him to spell it out for her. She had to actually apologize for not speaking the language and he didn't care less. Juacs with my order took forever to come.. Maybe I will come back to order drinks and sit at the patio, I will just make sure I tolerate shitty attitudes.

I remember living down the street when bucktown was a little more touch and go in the late 90's and the people were local and struggling artists.  This place takes me right back to '99.  It is real bucktown and the food is great.  They make non meat dishes good.  Give it a try

Let's just say that the only thing that I don't like about this place is that its not further from me. The food is so amazing that I will be frequenting it often! This review is for carry out, I haven't been able to dine in yet but I'm sure its amazing. I called in an order on a Thursday night and the food was done fast (around 15 minutes). I ordered the fried avocado tacos with a side of smoked gouda mac and my roommate had the green meanie with a side of sesame broccoli. The food was uhmaazzingggg, especially for an all vegetarian/vegan place! The tacos were perfectly balanced with avocado, ranch, and a light slaw on top. They're pretty big and come three to an order-I was full after just one! Made an awesome lunch for the next day. Now, let's get to the smoked gouda mac. Do you have any doubts that a gouda mac would be anything but spectacular? No, and nor should you. Super creamy and delicious, and also a huge portion! Definitely a must here. My roommate also loved her green meanie and broccoli as well. Definitely excited to dine in here and try their other options! I'm eyeing their queso fries, nachos,  sandwiches and of course DESSERT

I don't know what I was expecting on a hot muggy Sunday afternoon in August, maybe a decent meal perhaps, maybe a little service, it certainly would've been nice.  However, what I got was completely different than what I thought I was getting.   What I ordered was the chicken wrap with a side order of fries, skin on.  Nothing too difficult to make for even the most inexperienced chef or perhaps a home cook. Waited for 15 min. before they bestowed upon me their lackluster, unimaginative vegan creation.  For one thing, it didn't seem very fresh, or visually appealing, kind of like the looks of the Handlebar restaurant itself and it's waiters!   Fries weren't even crisp, kind of soggy and greasy like they had been sitting around awhile.  Chicken, or seitan, as it's called in the vegan lexicon, was blahsville too. I don't know what kind of seasonings they put on it, or in it, it just seemed kind of weak and lacked flavor, along with the tomatoes and wilted lettuce that accompanied it.  Honestly, I could've made a better sandwich.  Guess I can cross this place off my list because I probably won't be returning anytime soon! Suggestion:  Hire the manager/owner at Over Easy, I'm sure he could energize this place and get rid of their dopey waiters and produce much better results.  Which explains why they (Over Easy) have lines out the door and Handlebar...doesn't and never will!

After such rave reviews and my sis being a veggie, we thought this was worth checking out, especially as my cousin and I also aren't huge meat eaters. We were able to snag a table in their lovely outside patio Saturday evening around 7:30pm.  It took a long time for our server to come by to place orders. We finally did and our food took an extra long time to come. We heard that they have a small kitchen, but the table next to us got their food well before we did when they were seated a half hour after us. Our server was friendly, but he never really checked up on us. I understand the casual laidback 'hipster' atmosphere and certainly wasn't expecting fancy shmancy service, but it seemed like many of the servers had a 'did not care' attitude and/or were drunk. The server for a table next to us constantly came back and had to be reminded of what they wanted and seemed ultra aloof. This could all be remedied by their apparent stellar food, but that was such a disappointment. Almost everything was mad salty, especially their fries and catfish. I got the Chicago style tofu sandwich with mashed potatoes. The potatoes were meh. The sandwich was decently tasty and I enjoyed the giardiniera. However, one sad little tofu steak was swallowed by the hefty focaccia. The only positive thing was the black bean tostadas as those were very good. Everything else was barely average. Really don't understand why people think the food is so good here.

I really love this place i ordered a plate of vegan french toast and a half of vegan biscuits &gravy  After i took a bite of biscuits and gravy sauce i asked a waiter. Is this a vegan dish lol  just tasted like gravy cooked with meat that was how good it was.  I also ordered French toast with fresh fruitsz they were just too amazing and delicious that i didnt feel like i was eating vegan dish.  i really love this vegan french toast bc i dont taste egg taste.

The gin cocktails were refreshing and surprisingly strong. The tostada appetizer was tasty, I have never had a tostada like that before. The mushroom omelette and breakfast burrito were average. The music suited my taste and the place was nice and quiet during a Monday brunch.

Absolutely a must-do for vegans and non-vegans alike!  The food, drinks and Service are spot on.  I love all of the "familiar" food that can be made vegan and I nearly broke down when I saw fried pickles.  My absolute fav that I haven't been able to have in 2 years!!! Out of two - four thumbs up!!!

I'd give Handlebar five stars if it wasn't for the hair on our server. It was long, untamed, greasy and in his eyes. I worried it'd fall out any moment and into my food or drink. I get it, we're in Wicker Park, but.... a brush will do ya wonders. OK service (forgot a drink order, got one wrong, barely checked on us - did he know I didn't like his hair?), great food and good prices. If you're in the area and want some excellent vegetarian and vegan options (and just good stuff all around), check it out.

This place is magical! It's open from early morning and no one's to judge me for day drinking with my green meanie sandwich. The servers are super friendly and informative. I've been trying out a couple of new vegetarian restaurants around the neighborhood but none beats the good old Handlebar. Food here is just served as is, not overpriced nor over-accessorized for fresh goodness. And I get to sit out in the patio!
Crowded, but such good food that it's worth it.  Try the avocado tacos.
Wonderful meal and good service. 2nd best vegan restaurant in the city. Will be back for sure.

Yeah, the service is crappy and we had to flag our waitress to order (twice) but the food was pretty good. We started with fried pickles, which had the perfect ratio of breading to pickle, although the serving size was a bit small. The nachos were substantially larger and very tasty. The chili Mac attack was also great. HOWEVER, the chili Mac is basically the nachos but with pasta instead of chips. Our server didn't mention this when we ordered, and I was a bit disappointed to have basically ordered two of the same thing when there were so many options on the menu.

I love the food at this place, but I've never had good service here. Just wish they could hire people who cared just a little. I won't stop going because I love the food but please improve the service.

What a fabulous little gem of a place.  Some friends introduced me to this place last night, we got there late but service was awesome they were busy,  but the drinks arrived quickly,  the food was great! I'd recommend this place to hang out with your friends over a casual bite to eat.

Quirky food combos that don't quite hit the mark.  The omelet was ok, but the potatoes were dry.  The grilled cheese was pleasingly crunchy, but the accompanying soup was very strange. The coffee provided a caffeine boost, but was too bitter.  The food is mediocre, but the atmosphere is fun.  Lots of young people, creative decor, and unusual music.

Came here with my girlfriend and her sister after one long enjoyable evening, and breakfast was fantastic.  Their coffee, even better.  I couldn't stop drinking it as it was so good.  I believe it was Intelligentsia from we were told.  Either way, we are certainly coming back here. Thank you!

second visit was just as good. had the breakfast burrito and it was delicious. black beans were so good. so very good. i cant praise the beans enough. love this place. great atmosphere. great vegan/vegetarian/whatever food enjoyed by a carnivore.

Not being a vegetarian, but open to the experience, I expect a bit of finesse maybe, something new and exciting to the vegetarian meals I try?  There are moments where eating at Handlebar does deliver a new way to look at vegetarian food (like the biscuits and gravy) and there are times (like the BBQ tofu) where I wish I was eating something else.  Overall its a success. Their drinks are killer, and for the most part, the food is enjoyable, if not particularly inventive.

We visited this place twice during our short stay in Chicago. The food was great and the atmosphere (in the patio) was also great. Inside they play loud music so you have to consider this before you come here. Most of the dishes we tried were very good but one (the Sambal Tofu) was very oily, way over a normal level, and what could have been a great dish was just lost in a deep pool of oil. We still decided to give this place 5 stars since overall the food and the atmosphere were great.

Me and my friend ate out in their patio, and boy was it chill. The apartment above added to the experience, it was raw and organic, just like the healthy food that I was eating... get the Sambal tofu! Sooo filling and good!

My family and I visited Handlebar last summer, but I never got around to writing a review until now. If we didn't live so far out of the city we would probably be here ALL the time! Not only is there food amazing, but they also have great beer and a really cool/hipster atmosphere. I especially love Handlebar for the versatility of their menu. A lot of the menu items can be made vegan, which is a rarity among many restaurants. My family isn't vegan (while I am), but they all loved the vegan fried pickles and nachos. I had the Sambal Tofu and it was delicious! My family enjoyed their Chili Mac Attack, Blackened Catfish, and Shrimp and Grits. This is a great place to come if you are in a group with a variety of diets!

This is a great spot because they serve some seafood along with all of their wonderful vegetarian options. I had the country fried portabella on top of mashed potatoes with collard greens and smoked tofu recently... Amazing. My dining partner liked my vegan food better than his fish option! And I almost forgot the fried pickles! Heavenly. Great for brunch or dinner!

I really like this place if I want some low key vegetarian food and I'm in the Wicker Park neighborhood. The place is small and can get pretty packed pretty easily, but it electric that way--if you are alone and don't feel like doing work at a cafe, you can get lucky and find a seat at the bar.  Fer food, I recommend had their buffalo wrap. Their side of Garlic Mashed Potatoes and Chili are delicious compliments to any meal.  If you're thinking about brunch or popping by for weekend dinner--be aware that there might be a significant wait: this place gets real busy. Service can be slow every once in a while (that would be my one mark against Handlebar).

This place is great! The tacos I got here were superb (more Calimex or austinmex) and the drinks also phenomenal. The decor is on point with posters and original art mixed in (huge gallery wall). The service was very attentive and the music selection was great. I'm only in town for a day and a half but it's good enough that I was thinking of going back  even though it's a little out of the way. It's on the short list for the next time I'm in Chicago for sure!
This place is awesome. One of my favorite places to eat delicious vegetarian brunch while enjoying cheap & plentiful booze-treats.

Handlebar is great! So much wonderful vegan, vegetarian, and pescetarian food. Nachos are great for sharing, and I liked the shrimp and grits pretty well last time. The hot chocolate was absolutely necessary and delicious - it was so cold out!

Loved this place! It had a great atmosphere and wasn't too loud, it got pretty crowded towards the end of our meal and we were glad we came when we did. I would say it was too dark in there.  But other than that great food did didn't make me feel like crap and pretty good drink selection too. My roomate is vegan so she was happy. We will be back!

We came here for a weekend brunch at around 11AM and we were seated after a decent wait of around 10-15 minutes. Score! The place is small and there were a lot of other people waiting, and it was a bit congested. I felt like we were in the way with the servers and other guests trying to get around us. They should probably take people's numbers and text them when their tables are ready. There simply isn't room for people to wait. I was appreciative of the table because we were quoted a longer wait than what we actually had.  There were so many menu items that looked amazing, but my lovely boyfriend ended up agreeing to just split two vegetarian-friendly entrees that looked equally appetizing. We shared the pepita scramble and the green monster sandwich. Both were delicious, but I thought the pepita scramble was the standout. It was balanced with greens, potatoes, eggs, and veggies. I felt like eating that entire myself instead of sharing, but I was able to control myself. The green monster, which is a goat cheese sandwich, was a little disappointing. Even though it was filled with dark leafy greens, which is fantastic, I was sad that I could barely even taste the goat cheese. At one point I even opened it and took a look inside to make sure there was any goat cheese at all! My boyfriend agreed with my sentiments; the pepita scramble was the clear winner. I highly recommend trying it!  There were a lot of other menu items that looked veeeeeery appetizing, so I'm sure I'll be back at some point. I would like to give Handlebar five stars, but it sits at a comfortable four stars because of the scrimping on the goat cheese. As a pescetarian (and former vegetarian), I really appreciate a place that has plenty of delicious, healthy, yet not overly so food. I'm not a fan of eating suuuper healthy vegetarian/vegan food. Sometimes we need the comfort mac and cheese or french toast, too!

I dig it here. I came up for a day trip from Indy and was on the prowl for a spot with great vegetarian options. I hit the gold mine!  I checked out a lot of different spots that Yelp highlighted but this place really spoke to me. The vibe was hipster of course. We just split the pickles and nachos so I didn't get to explore as much of the menu as I would have liked to but what I did get was phenom. I will be happy to return on my next Chicago trip.

I (avid meateater) thought I'd give this Vegetarian restaurant a try.  I was surprised to see a lot of seafood items on the menu and ordered the Blackened Catfish. Perfectly cooked, flavorful, seasoned just right - I ate every bite.  The smoked gouda mac was great.  My friend ordered the Veggie Chili Mac Attack, which she inhaled before I could try a bite, so I'm guessing it was delicious as well. Good drinks, friendly service, casual cool atmosphere.

Love this place. Has great vegetarian/vegan food. It's hard to find good vegetarian food that's full of good flavor and this place has it all. Their nachos are amazing (even better than nachos with real meat)! Their portion sizes are good too and they have an outside seating area.

I wanted to try a new place in West side of Chicago for brunch. Let's just say I made a bad call. The place is cute, but the staff is not good. They start off the day by saying, they will not allow a party bigger than 4 to sit with each other. There was 6 of us, it's not that big of a group. Then we decided to go somewhere else so we could sit together, and then they changed their minds (or didn't want to lose the business) so they said they had a table for 6, but they had 1 woman sitting there eating a sandwich but she'll be done in 5 minutes. That 5 minutes turned into 20 and then another 20 until they eventually just sat us at another table that was big enough and outside. Since it was too cold to sit outside, they gave us a heat lamp which made it better. I tried the biscuits and gravy. It wasn't great. Too little biscuit, too much gravy. They should serve straws with the dish instead of a fork. Everyone else in the group was less than impressed. Bad call on my part. Sometimes, it's good to stick with the classics of Wicker like Bongo Room or Birchwood.

Such a great little place!  I got the diablos with tofu and seitan. The dish was great, very flavorful and spicy.  The vibe was cool and trendy, and the music was perfect. I already know what I plan to get next time I visit. I would absolutely recommend a meal here.

I love handlebar for lunch or casual dinner. I like to share the samosas or the fried pickles (both vegan) and I generally get the Everything Green salad with the vegan ranch instead of goddess dressing.  It's healthy and delicious.  I prefer to go there instead of take-out because the last couple of times I got take-out the samosas were almost burned and the salad was about 75% of what I get in-store (which is why I am withholding one star).

Until we looked at the menu while sitting in the restaurant, I didn't know that this was a vegetarian/vegan spot, but I'm glad that I have another arrow in the quiver when my vegan friends need an option. Tried the biscuits and gravy for brunch today...the dish was an interesting concoction.  Seitan sausage was apparently in the gravy, and the consistency was actually pretty good.  The biscuit was ok--and I couldn't tell if there was just the one biscuit or maybe a second hiding in the gravy?--and while this won't replace some of my other sausage gravy and biscuit spots in town it was just fine.  What really worked were the $4 mimosas and the large back patio, which worked out better than expected today thanks to a handy heat lamp placed next to our shaded table.  Prices for the amount of food you get here are also very fair. Flying Saucer is still my go-to for vegan friends for brunch, but if I'm in Wicker and need an out, this might be the call.  Also a shout-out to the hostess today, who was either hopped up on uppers or just sincerely excited to be alive.  Either way, a ton of energy (this wouldn't be for everyone, but I liked it).

What a place! I was in town visiting friends and this is one of there favorite near by restaurants!  They have great drink specials and kick ass food!  To start we had the fried pickle spear and they were awesome. It was a smaller appetizer with only 5 spears but was well worth it! The sauce that came with the app was superb!  I has the ahi tuna steak sandwich with the house cut French fries! It was great! They are know for there appetizers and nachos! I loved this place! The food, the atmosphere, the style, creativity and diversity in the menu, the staff! This place is a must and I can see why the locals love it!  The only downside is I tried to buy a shirt on the way out but the didn't have my size, Probably because everyone loves this place just as much as I did! I will be back handlebar! Cheer!

This place is pretty awesome, and a great place for brunch. Try the Bloody Mary for sure! It's popping too, it took a bit to get sat and there is not much room to stand but the wait is worth it. I had the burrito and my date had the nachos, they were both spot on. The service was nice but could of been more attentive, and the sauces at our table were empty :( I'll be back though for sure!

Oh, it's just so good. The peanut stew, the vegan breakfast options, the desserts, the beer options.... it's all so very, very good. Seriously good food. I have to take off a star because of the noise level. I know they say not to ask to turn down the music on their website, but I really believe sometimes they are just deliberately over the top. One time I actually walked out because it was so loud that I almost started crying. It just hurt. No one needs music that loud unless they are at a concert. Often the noise is just fine here, but sometimes they just push it over a level that could be considered acceptable.
Since this was my first visit.  I thought if I ordered the samosa and green vegetables, I would be safe - NOT! The water was cold and refreshing.

No doubt about it - I've got a soft spot for vegetarian food. But, the Handlebar will also win over the stomachs of the more carnivorous-leaning crowds. We brunched on the off-street, backyard patio on an unseasonably delightful mid-March Sunday. On the menu for us...  *Chimichanga, more or less a breakfast burrito smothered in creamy queso, chile sauce (low intensity heat levels), pico de gallo, and guac. This beast of a breakfast is highly recommended - but you'll likely be busting at the seams if you finish single-handedly in one sitting. * Roasted Mushroom Omelet (served with a side of breakfast potatoes, don't think along the lines of greased up hashbrowns) was also really good, but couldn't quite live up to the sinful deliciousness of the Chimichanga. The mushrooms were sliced thick and had plenty of flavor - clearly not the oft-used canned variety.  The drawbacks. *The service was discombobulated, nearly disoriented, when it came to the logistics of turning over tables and seating the constant stream of new customers. However, this did not too drastically impact speed of service or server attitude.  *The punk vibe just does not jive too well with me. It is easy to overlook when dining outside, but you will be subjected to terrible music if you are seated indoors.

Hands down, the best breakfast food in the city. I'm vegan but my family of carnivores begs me to bring them back to Handlebar every time their in town. My favorites are the country fried portobello, biscuits and gravy with blackened tofu, and the vegan diablos.  Food is always consistent. Cool vibe. Can get a bit loud and very busy on the weekends during brunch time so keep that in mind.  Never pass on the PB&J fried pies! You'll regret it!

This place is so awesome. Great environment and excellent staff. I had the vegan buffalo chiken wrap and it was amazing! I would definitely go here again and try all the other vegan items they have. Love this place.
Great spot! Good food menu that caters to vegans and meat eaters alike! Service is usually pretty good as well. They also have a good craft beer menu!

Handlebar is the perfect go-to neighborhood place.  They have a different special every day of the week, the the decor is fun to stare at for hours, and the servers are great.  This weekend I had my first brunch experience.  I'd give it a 5 star review for brunch alone, but I've struck out with dinners a little.  I ordered the diablos (with eggs and cheese) along with a side of biscuits and gravy.  Quick aside: I haven't eaten meat in 10 years and there are certain meals I thought I would never get  the opportunity to try...so my heart jumped with joy at the chance to try biscuits and gravy for the first time! So freaking good...almost as good as the diablos.  They include a hefty amount of this absolutely perfect chipotle sauce (with just the right amount of kick to it).  My only real complaint was how full I was by the end of my meal! Also: serious bonus points to the server/host on making sure to continually update people waiting...best brunch host I've ever seen!! I've also had dinner here 3 or so times.  There are plenty of options, but I feel like I've struck out a little.  The first time I had them, I ordered the fish tacos take out...they just didn't hold up well, even though I live really close.  Not necessarily the restaurant's fault, but I wouldn't order that as carry-out ever again.  The second time I ate in the restaurant and got the avocado tacos.  That's probably my favorite thing I've gotten from there: very tasty and unlike anything I normally order.  The third time I tested my luck with carry-out again and ordered the buffalo chicken wrap.  If you like spicy food, you'll love it, but it was wayyyy too strong for me...pass the ranch dressing! However: there is one dinner menu item that is pure perfection: the mac and cheese.  I've also stolen bites of the chili mac and could eat that goodness all day. I haven't lived in the area long enough to experience the patio, but it looks like the perfect patio for happy hour or Sunday Funday drinking...if the weather ever warms up!

The food was ok. I have been here twice and have a hard time finding this place as awesome as most of the reviewers and some people I talk about it have. The service is just fine. The music is too loud to have a conversation. The most important thing, the food! Presentation is poor, placing of the items in the plate is strange. This time I ordered the seitan giros and the pita bread was under all the ingredients and soggy. So, I couldn't actually use the pita bread for my seitan giros since it was unreachable. The taste I didn't enjoy very much either. The fries with a piece of cheese on top half melted on a side... messy plate too. My companions plate: a wrap with tons of lettuce and a couple of meat ball in there.  There are so many nice vegetarian / vegan places fast foodish style in town I can't understand why this place is this popular. I guess it has been longer in town than any of the others.

Great bicycle punk atmosphere, and delicious, no fuss contemporary food. My favorites include fried avocado tacos, ground nut stew, and the fries. If they have the Peanut Butter and Jelly Pies, they're definitely worth it.

Bland food, subpar service, with a redeeming atmosphere. While I enjoyed the bloody slammer (ask for the fried pickle), most everything else lacked substance. The egg and sausage sandwich was salty and lacked flavor. The biscuits and gravy were boring. The French Toast was a bit soggy. Overall, brunch wasn't that great.

I am not a vegan, naturalist, into organic eating, or any of that wholesome trend but this place.....OMG sooooo good! I had the special Kimchi Tofu Sandwich which was a great blend of fried tofu, wasbai and kimchi on a roll. Soooooo good!! And the mac side, is creamy goodness!  I liked it better than I thought I would! I'd go back for sure! It is loud and hopping so if you wanted some place where you can hear yourself or even your company talk... this may not be the place but the food alone is worth it in my book!
The Black Bean Maduro gives me life.

I'm typically a meat eater so when I had a friend visiting from out of town and said she wanted to try a vegan/vegetarian place, I was hesitant but soldiered on and found this place on Yelp. I was impressed. We came on a Saturday night around 8pm and the restaurant was full with a good 30 minute wait before we got seated. The ambiance of the restaurant is definitely of the Wicker Park variety with a little angst and soft lit candlelight.  For food, we ordered the nachos with chorizo seitan, polenta and sweet potato tots, bbq chicken seitan wrap, and blackened catfish with chili and greens. The good held its own and if I didn't know any better, I would've thought it was normal meat. Actually, I've had normal meat that tasted worse than this in restaurants so Handlebar has definitely changed my stance on vegetarian food. All of the food was seasoned and cooked well. The chorizo seitan in the nachos didn't make me miss ground beef one bit. The chili was so so tasty and the greens were cooked perfectly and seasoned just with garlic and salt. It was simple yet delicious. Obviously we over ordered a bit but I'm glad I tried everything that we did.  I would encourage everyone to come here and try some of their dishes with open minds and you'll probably come out having more appreciation for vegetarian/vegan dishes like me!

I've been coming here with my sister and friends since 2008. Handlebar is by far one of my most favorite places to go in the city. It's just the right amount of dive and classic bar scene with great beers and amazing vegan diner food.  My absolute favorite thing to order is the Buffalo "Chicken" Wrap & fries. I get it every single time! The atmosphere is nice, cozy and dimly lit, but can be a little overwhelmingly loud when packed - it just means they're doing things right. While I like coming here year round, I LOVE coming when it's nice out and the backyard patio is open!
i love how the green onions are cut on the pickles and biscuit n gravy! thank you for cutting them so pretty i really appreciate it.  thank you!

Vegetarian and loud heavy metal are surprisingly a good combination.  My ground nut stew was hearty and needed for a cod winters night.  I would come back FOR SURE as long as my grandmother wasn't accompanying me.

An overdue review, but hey.  Really loved this place. Great vibe and freaking great food!  Nachos... on point! Got Kale Salad.. yummotastic!  Daughter had chili which was legit as well. A for sure "come back to" place!!

Delicious food and Big Sound The best spicy tofu I ever had in my life ! It was so spicy I couldn't feel my face after I finished.  Its so good that I haven't been able to order anything else in the menu every time I'm there regardless of all the  great vegetarian and vegan options. It was so loud I couldn't hear my date across the table. Overall its a very electric N.Y.C style atmosphere to sit and eat while listening to loud music. By the way this is my first post on Yelp, lost my yelp virginity.

The food: 5/5. I went there with a vegetarian friend and both of us liked our food. It was cold out, so I got their blackened catfish with mashed potatoes, which definitely hit the spot. We also had samosas as an app and I had gin lemonade to drink, which didn't disappoint. I'm a gin drinker, and the drink was strong, fresh and not sweet.  The service: 5/5. The atmosphere is definitely hipster, but far from pretentious. Our server was friendly and gave good recommendations when I was indecisive between two mains.  Overall: 5/5. I'm not a vegetarian and I was impressed by this place. Will definitely go back.

Looks like vegetarians and vegans can have fun too. Handlebar is not your average brunch spot--even in the early morning people are crowded around the bar drinking. And everyone here is sporting a very impressive beard. Why? I do not know but I thought it added character. It was a laid back atmosphere and getting a table was pretty easy at 11 on a Saturday. We were placed in the elevated seating area adjacent to the bar and our server immediately took our orders. Our party shared fried pickles and French toast as appetizers. The pickles were addictive and the my friend and I wished that they served them in French fry quantities. Following with French toast was perfect since it wasn't too sweet and came crispy while topped with fresh berries. For my main dish I had the vegan style pepita scramble. Damn good. The kale and tofu provided for a hearty dish while the onion petals added a tasty crunch. Also loved that the dish packed some good heat. Only complaint is that the potatoes looked a bit lifeless but that wasn't a big issue. Service here is friendly and my friends all enjoyed their dishes. Will hopefully be back!
Good beer? Buffalo Chick'n Wrap? What's not to love.

Love this place. The food is good and the service is ok but it's a bar. I don't go there to have my table crumbed. The booze prices are unbelievable. What a fantastic value. I especially recommend their tequila selection, and by that I mean have the Fortalese Anjeo.

Yummy spot with easy street parking. Food was delicious and well priced. The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars was that even though the place was nearly empty, they wouldn't seat me until my 2 friends arrived. I would totally understand this if the place was packed, but there were tons of empty tables.

One of my favorite spots in the city. As a vegetarian and regular cyclist, I guess I'm the target audience...but it's great if you're not either of those things too! The menu offers great variety and it's an excellent place to introduce meat eaters to vegetarian eating. The servers are cool and fast, and the prices are very reasonable. Quality, fresh food and a good beer list. Good for brunch, lunch and dinner, it can get crowded at peak times so plan ahead. Rotating list of specials too. Well worth the trip, I'll be back soon.

I've been coming here for years.  Great vegan brunch options.  Love the cornmeal battered fried dill pickles.  Super comfy and always a great playlist going on.  I also like it because it's a great hangout for friends or even the parents.  Do the bloody hammer--as a self proclaimed bloody mary expert, it's damn good.

No reservations taken. Short wait (10 min) table for two. The Handlebar salad was OK. I was expecting fair sized slices of pears, but it seems that they had removed most of the flesh of the pears. The pears themselves were at the bottom of the salad. I enjoyed the gouda mac premium side more than the salad. Sides are given with entrees but not salad :( My friend had the Green Meanie sandwich. She said that she would probably ask for the multigrain not to be toasted in the future, otherwise it was good. I need to try the fried pickles that others have recommended. The atmosphere was incredibly loud at 7pm on a weekday. My friend and I had to yell at each other to practically converse. Tables are seated extremely close together.

This is my go to spot. Love the food, the mac and cheese is wonderful and the small cozy vibes are great. Sunday nights they show a double feature, and it's always something kitschy and fun. Love the fried fruit pies as well. Wish they'd increase their cider selection tho, for us cider lovers.

Saturday night double date at 6:30. Best blackened catfish ever had in the city.  Chili and Guacamole are amazing too. A beer special helped keep the total bill down and the waiter gave appropriate amount of service and attitude for the neighborhood. Well done handlebar, you've made me a fan and I'll be back.
Nice selection of beer and even better veg food. It's nice to find a veg restaurant with a full bar that's open late.
I'm trying to call to place an order for pick up but the line is disconnected...? I gave this place a chance once, and it was okay. Now, the second try is not going to be happening.

I feel a little embarrassed to admit the sheer number of times I've eaten their food, but I need to spread the good word. I left the vegan sahara desert that is Lincoln Park for vegetarian friendly Wicker/Humboldt neighborhood and couldn't be happier. I live a block from Handlebar and have dined in or taken out no less than 5 times in the past week and a half (3 meals in 3 days is my current record). I just can't help myself...I love this place for it's creative vegan/vegetarian fare. My go-to has always been the pepita pesto w/blackened tofu for brunch (DO IT) and the sambal tofu for dinner (ALWAYS WITH FRIED PICKLES) so a few times forced myself to branch out and of course was not disappointed. The diablos vegan w/blackened tofu are ridiculous...they come on homemade tostones, covered in chipotle sauce w/black beans, avocado & chorizo seitan. I'm not a big fake meat girl so would skip this in future, but otherwise this thing was where it's at. If you want a variation of this for dinner, order the black bean tostadas w/blackened tofu.  Also noteworthy and amazing is any special they have, their soups, chili, 'chicken' wrap and probably everything else on the menu. Which, I will conquer. Tonight is their special vegan burger & it's got my name written all over it.  Also, super friendly, great enclosed patio in back & it's usually nice and warm in there. Things that are important to me. Easy street parking. No-brainer. Get there.

This place is one of those places that you leave saying, "Wow. That was damn good!" I ordered the "Chicago Style Tofu" with "pesto tofu, giardiniera, garlic aioli, dijon, arugula, tomato, celery salt, focaccia." Go check that out.  The price is right and cool vibes as well.

This is vegan breakfast for the soul. The fried portobello fried bowl was delicious and the gravy was one of the best I've had in quite some time. Expect a bit of a chaotic wait, however I'd go back in a flash.

Looks like a cool neighborhood bar and a great addition to the Humboldt Park area. What I thought was super cool was the fact that their jukebox has a ton of spanish music which you normally do not see elsewhere. I am talking about spanish salsa, reggeaton, merengue and bachata songs. The people I was with also said their second floor is pretty cool and good for private events however I didnt get to go up there. I also got the impression they did not serve food given my friend brought in pizzas from outside but I see reviews that mention food items so who knows. I'll def be coming back on a Thursday/Friday night to check out their drink specials and their ambiance.

Handlebar provides consistently delicious food and drink, very good service, and a welcoming comfortable environment with a changing display of the work of local artists. Patio is lovely when the weather cooperates and they have heaters for when it's nippy! I highly recommend Handlebar. The coffee is very good, especially during the week when Zach is the barista.   The menu is creative vegetarian or vegan or pescatarian food with perfect price point and full bar. Breakfast is available daily until 3 PM! I love the whole wheat biscuits and gravy, the roasted mushroom omelette, vegan diablos, egg scramble and Seitan chorizo sandwich with cheddar. The husband enjoys the egg diablos, the pepita scramble, the green meanie, the cat fish poor boy. Special requests can be accommodated. I substitute egg whites for eggs, black beans for potatoes, multigrain for sourdough. The salads are excellent. The vegetarian chili is top notch. Broccoli can be served steamed instead of with the soy sesame sauce. The sides of fruit are always tasty! The family enjoys the oatmeal creme pie which is vegan. I absolutely adore the chocolate cake which is brought in from Bake down the street. Jalapeños and pickles are made in house. Pico de gallo, Diablo, chipolte, and salsas are all made in house and delicious! Very high quality beers on tap. Daily drink specials. Daily beer specials. Huge Bloody Mary and mimosas. In summer they have a scrumptious Hibiscus iced tea that can be served virgin or with vodka. I enjoy the NA Clausthaler beer. Street parking is NOT metered/pay to park. Tons of bicycle racks in front and back!!!! Clientele is mixed with lots of bicyclists, artists, musicians, and off duty service industry personnel. I love Handlebar!

Remember the food you liked when you were a kid? There's a Dairy Queen near the corner of 73rd and Taft Street in Merrillville, Indiana, and all through high school and college, I'd go there and get a sloppy joe. Oh boy, was that thing good. Big fresh bun, and a huge pile of sloppy, messy, delicious meat. It was fantastic. I loved it. In the intervening years, I became a vegetarian. When I drove by that Dairy Queen, I'd think of that sloppy joe with fondness, but I never went in. What, me eat dead animals? Not a chance.  My friend Jean suggested we go for dinner at Handlebar. I knew Handlebar's reputation, but had never visited. Before agreeing to go, I checked out the menu online. I zeroed in on one item -- they had a sloppy joe. It was made from "carne de soya." A taste memory filled me mouth. OK, Jean, Handlebar it is! Although located perilously close to the hipster heaven of Wicker Park, we were able to find free parking on North Avenue. Granted, we went on a Monday night, but hey -- first impressions count.  Entering the restaurant, we saw a bar off to the right, and about half the tables were occupied. We stood at the entrance, taking the lay of the land for a minute, and giving all those oh-so-young diners an opportunity to wonder why two age 50+ women were there. A host greeted us and said, do you prefer to eat indoors or outdoors? This was the Monday in late October where the daytime temperature had reached 73 degrees. We sat outside, under a canopy. It's a very pleasant space. Since it's in back of the restaurant, there are no car or bus fumes to swallow along with your dinner. Quieter, too.  We each had a glass of red wine. Sorry, I can't tell you what kind, but we both were happy. Then, the main course. When my carne de soya sloppy joe arrived, it looked right. It smelled right. I had added avocado to it, for an extra cost, because I thought it would be the perfect fit with a spicy sloppy joe. This sandwich was fantastic. It fulfilled all my dreams. It was everything my 17-year-old self had enjoyed, and which I had craved ever since. Messy, hot, spicy, delicious. My mouth is watering for it right now.  I chose a side order of garlic mashed potatoes, and it was scrumptious. Jean had a vegetable stir-fry that was a special that night. She enjoyed it. It looked good, and I'll try to load a photo of it. She was very, very happy with her meal. It wasn't a sloppy joe, so I don't really care. Very satisfied, very happy, comfortably full, and oh so happy we came. We'll be back. I may even try something different on the menu. Well . . . maybe not for a while. Handlebar is proof that you can be a vegan and still enjoy wonderful Midwestern comfort food.

I've been here a few times and while I haven't always loved everything I've ordered, I have liked enough of their entrees to continue coming back.  Their food is completely meet free but you'd never know it. If you're meet-asour like me you can eat a good meal here without feeling like a rabbit. I always get the nachos! The seitan chorizo is amazing! You won't be sorry. They also have a full bar so washing down their great good with your favorite beer or spirit is definitely on the menu. Handlebar is a good place to being my veggie-saur friends from NYC and they love it.

SO. DAMN. GOOD. Love it all. Can't go wrong with the fish tacos, sambal tofu, gouda mac and always start with the kale salad. I haven't ever had anything I didn't like. Great seasonal cocktail menu that changes often.  Only caveat, not a good place for bigger parties. I wouldn't try and go here with a party larger than 4 or you may be waiting a very long time.

Good beer. Good cocktails. Great vegetarian food. Prices here could be much higher and I appreciate that they keep them modest. I had a great wilted kale salad here with quinoa and cranberries. I would for sure come back when I am in a veggie kick. Having this in the neighborhood is a great treat.

BOMB.COM No one even says that anymore, but who cares?! Brunch and Dinner are amazing here. Must haves: Bloody Hammer, Chimichanga, Diablos, Fish Tacos, Tuna Sandwich, Avocado Tacos, and friend pickles.  The music is loud during dinner, so not the best place to take your grandparents to, but who needs to talk when you are stuffing your face? Great Sunday special (Tequila and Tacos).
Really good food! The avocado tacos are great!

Fantastic meal, prices are reasonable. Great options for vegetarians and vegans.  Would give it 5 stars but I'm not super impressed with their seating outside. If you're a party of two you pretty much sit on top of the the people next to you and don't ask them to seat you at a four top because it won't happen.

Handlebar is a gem in the neighborhood. Not only do they have the best vegan vegetarian crafted food, the ambience and the next door patio is really fun. The good always comes out nice and hot, the service is very friendly, and there are plenty of spots to lock up your bike. Seitan chorizo nachos will knock your socks off with the fresh guacamole.

heard a lot about this place from chicagians, mainly the biscuits and gravy. i finally made the plunge and checked it out. ordered the vegan biscuits and gravy and a vegan breakfast burrito. the biscuits and gravy blew my mind. may look different up front but the flavors were popping. a bit on the spicy side too. the burrito was absolute aces. seitan chorizo, avocado, fried potatoes, spinach, etc.. so good. i ate both meals and didnt feel like i was going to die. i actually fought a wild bear afterwards and won. so great food! service was unreal friendly and quick. update - 2015: after eating here several more times, 5 stars and possibly my new last meal on earth kind of joint.

We moved to Chicago in February, and have been super excited about all the vegan options in this city. I heard amazing things about Handlebar from various people, vegan and not, and it has such good reviews here, that it was really high on my list of places to try.  We went a few weekends ago for lunch, and it was pretty damn disappointing. We tried the fried pickles, fried avocado tacos,  buffalo "chicken" wrap, and some oatmeal cookie dessert. The friend pickles were pretty terrible. We moved here from North Carolina, where there are a lot of very good fried pickles, so maybe I have high expectations. But these were super fried, so all you tasted was the batter- with no pickle goodness inside.  The Fried Avocado tacos were pretty boring. I really like the Baja Blackened Tacos at Native Foods, and these just didn't compare.  The Buffalo "chicken" wrap was similarly boring. It included very little buffalo "chicken" and a lot of lettuce. Just not very much flavor at all.  The dessert was way too sweet.  On top of all that, the service was pretty terrible. I could see our waiter hanging out at the bar, chatting with friends the whole time. He barely checked in on us once.  I'd heard Handlebar was a hipster joint, and I was expecting that, but I was also expecting some great food. And it just didn't deliver.

This place is not entirely vegan, so you have to make sure to remind them you want them to make ur food vegan--if you're vegan, that is. We ordered ... + Fried avocado Tacos  -- the best vegan tacos i've had ever - Samosas - it was okay, mostly just potatoes and peas - Gouda mac and cheese , idk about these because my mac n cheese look a lot drier than in the pics here on Yelp. It was not worth it to me. -Oatmeal cookies dessert thing .. i took one bite and thaat ... was ... enough lol.

generally a huge fan of this place but i seriously think i will have a hard time going back after the experience i had here for a friends birthday.  she turned 21 the evening before so she was ready to lay down a few drinks, but by the looks of it, our waiter had beat her to the (spiked) punch. he was acting so drunk i dont know how we were able to get the correct order. a very disappointing experience here at handlebar.  im not sure where this type of behavior is acceptable but we were trying to put in our order for about twenty minutes when we realized he was out smoking behind the patio and chatting with people...WHAT?! As a server elsewhere i try to be super considerate of having a shitty shift and whatnot but cmon.. not sure if i will go back after how we were treated

Handlebar needs to put a handle on their staff.  Popped in for sat brunch and had a tecate, buffalo wrap w/ Gouda mac, friends had scrambled tofu, a diablo and hubby, the sloppy joe w/fries. Sloppy joe was out of this damn world. Mac was beyond phenomenal. We were happy as can be and asked for the bill.  That's when things flew off the handle. Hub and I wanted to pay our portion in cash and our friends wanted all their stuff on 1 credit card. Waiter dude took our $40 cash yet swiped friend's card for the whole damn bill. Umm, homey, wtf you thinking? #1, You don't deserve a $40 tip and #2, you clearly wiped your ass with my instructions. I bit my tongue, called him over, and explained the issue. He said he's sorry and would fix it. I control my breathing momentarily. He came back with the credit card swiped for only $10 less than previously. DUDE, now it's on.  I stood up and immediately walked to the bar because I couldn't wait another 15 min for him to make his rounds. I had to break down our extremely simple method of payment like I was talking to my 5 y/o nephew: "bill is for $90, I have you $40 in cash, 90-40=50. See?" The light bulb finally went off in his head. He apologized again.  I'm 99% sure the server was stoned out of his mind. While I have nothing against doing whatever you want to your body as a grown-ass man, just don't let that interfere with carrying out your job! I might return to handlebar solely for this sloppy joe and Mac but I would do take-out, quadruple check my bill and pay in the simplest form possible since it's obvs these employees can't handle their duties.

I don't know where to begin. I guess my biggest issue with this restaurant is not knowing what to order since everything on the menu sounds amazing. First off, they have a good beer selection. So if you like to drink but don't like the nearby bars, this would be a good place to check out. Second, they're food is addicting. It's a great place for vegetarians and vegans. I have been searching for a good vegan restaurant that offered more than hummus. The best part is that most of their entrees are vegetarian but can be made vegan. Win win for cheese addicts like myself and my non cheese fanatic boyfriend. The only downside is that the tables are super crowded and you can overhear other peoples conversations. Other than that the portions are generous, including the appetizers. Seriously, I couldn't eat my third taco since I was so full from our black bean tostadas which were also amazing!

Handlebar is a go-to place for comfort food that doesn't leave you feeling guilty afterward. The Sunday special (2 fried avocado tacos, a shot of tequila and a beer for $10) is a great deal (and a good excuse to start your meal with a shot of tequila!) Get the queso fries. And if you're there for brunch, splurge for the Bloody Hammer. The fried pickle and Tito's make a huge difference.

You'll see some of the best beards and 'staches in Chicago here. Between the staff and the customers, on a scale of 1 to hipster it's somewhere between vintage typewriter and an old 2X4 skateboard. That being said...the service is actually super friendly instead of what you may think of when someone says it's "hipster."  Very vegetarian and vegan friendly menu although it wouldn't really matter to any meat eater since the food is absolutely unbelievable regardless of what you get. I did the country friend portabello and it was so damn good that even after a pesky fly from the outdoor patio got stuck in it I couldn't give the dish up. I just ate around his landing.  Drinks are affordable and they have $3 Malort which is about a dollar less than most places that carry this disgusting-yet-hard-to-say-no-to shot.

My girlfriend and I were really excited to finally go to this place. However I have to say we were disappointed. While the beer selection was good but not great the prices were affordable but the food was nothing to write a great review about. It was vegan but everything was very spicy. This is coming from someone who loves hot in heat but this just was heat to give it some flavor on food that otherwise would have none I don't think I will be heading back

For vegetarian fare, this place is like coming home to your mamma after being lost on the ocean for a month, battered by the sea waves, circled by hungry sharks as you float  in terror on top of a refrigerator box. Im a big fan of vegetarian food. Im sure this place is good for vegetarians and omnivores alike because the food is so damned inventive and frankly not boring at all. I hates me some boring food, this place has none on the menu.

Super awesome Vegan/Vegetarian food! I loved the Diablos. The have the best chorizo and tofu on them. The rice and beans were a perfect addition. I even added cheese and avocado it made it delicious. Neato atmosphere as well.

Is this egg? No, it's tofu! But...it's...so...good! Ordered the pepita scramble, subbed the egg for tofu, and it was the most filling, delicious, and light breakfast i've had in a while! The pumpkin pesto, breakfast potatoes, and the kale made the dish! I would definitely order this again! If you're looking for a place to feel full but not lethargic, this is it! :)
One of the best places to have brunch. Incredible vegetarian food options. Amazing taste. Nice backyard outdoor seating. Good beer. Is anything more required? :)

Suggestion to manager|owner: Consider not allowing smoking on the patio. Given the demographic you target allowing smoking might make 1 patron happy but makes it unpleasant for 9 others.  Otherwise great food highly recommend

Went here for the first time last night with my boyfriend, we came in around 11 since the kitchen is open until 12:30 (which is awesome in and of itself.) I got the Sambal Tofu and he got the Buffalo Chicken Wrap. SOOO good, I was full but I couldn't stop trying to stuff more of this food into my mouth. I can't wait to try this place again

If you're in the mood for vegetarian/vegan I can't say enough great things about Handlebar.  The food and flavors are very delicious, and they have a great beer list and cocktails as well. This has nothing to do with the restaurant, but at the table next to us was a male and female.  The male had just gotten married, and this female was a platonic friend.  Long story short at this guy's wedding his stepdad tried to get this girl into a three-way.  She was showing this guy the text messages. Stepdads out there:  if you're trying to wrangle a three-way with your stepson's friends, don't text them.  That's just evidence. 192/365

I'm in Chicago this week and had found out about Handlebar on Yelp when looking for Vegetarian/Vegan restaurants.  First of all, Handlebar has basically the coolest ambience/decorations ever. You walk in and are accosted by bright artworks and posters immediately, which add to the overall hip vibe. I sat out on the back patio because it was pretty nice out. The back patio has vines overhanging and is quaint and clean. The bathroom was clean and had some graffiti (none of which was offensive an actually added to the overall feel of the restaurant).  The service was pretty good, but it took a while to get our drinks and the check. The check probably took a while because it started to get quite busy as the lunch went on, so that's pretty understandable. Our server was perfectly nice and affable. The food itself is incredible. My group ordered the ancho-spiced veggie chili jack cheese fries to start and were pretty impressed. The fries were well done and crispy, but not oily whatsoever. The chili had a great robust smoky flavor with well-cooked beans scattered throughout. The cheese was pretty good, but nothing to write home about. The fries were a great vegetarian take on typical bar fare. I ordered the Chicago style tofu with fried plantains and my companions shared the sloppy joe with smoked gouda mac. The Chicago style tofu was incredibly fresh. The focaccia was chewy and thick, a supreme example of focaccia. The pesto tofu was blackened perfectly and had a great meaty texture. The vegetables (tomato, arugula, giardiniera) on the sandwich were fresh and slightly sweet. The dijon and garlic aioli added the perfect kick and smoothness to the sandwich. I didn't try the fried plantains, because I don't really like fried plantains due to their texture and thought when ordering that they would be plantain chips. This was just a misstep in my judgement though. I also ordered a Mexican Coca Cola, which I've been dying to try. It was a thousand times fresher and much more natural tasting than American Coca Cola. You could for sure taste the difference and the bottle was so cute. I much prefer it to American Coca Cola. The bite of sloppy joe I had was delicious and had a classic sloppy joe flavor, without any of the meat. The smoked gouda mac had kind of a thin sauce and was a bit bland, but the delicious smoked flavor was there for sure. Overall Handlebar has fresh, flavorful food that utilizes some very creative ideas (blackened tofu!) and is fairly priced. It's in a great location and has great ambience. It's a great place for any vegan or vegetarian (or anyone looking for fresh, flavorful food). The service could be a tiny bit better, but overall it's a solid place with intriguing food.

I love this place. The staff is quirky yet friendly, the atmosphere is casual and fun, and the courtyard is so lovely. They have a great drink menu and SO MANY creative vegetarian and vegan options. Amazing breakfast, lunch, dinner, and drinks. You can't go wrong. Would be five stars but sometimes the food is just a little too greasy (I'm looking at you--fried plantains.)  Check out this neighborhood hotspot, It's one of my favorites!
Grea food, great service.  They need to do something about the awful dumpster smell when you sit outside in the back.  Fans or something.  It was awful!
Great healthy options available. The everything green salad is the boom!
Three words... Fried avocado tacos. Worth the trip just to try them!
The pepita scramble is a brunch staple. Great cup of coffee too. Love Handlebar.

Not sure if this is an oxy moron but this is the most hipstery vegetarian place I have ever been to!   Hipster or not, their food is delicious.  It was rainy and damp out, making me want something warm for my hungry tummy so I ordered the ground nut stew.  It was so good, I couldn't stop eating.  Plus it made you feel like you were eating something really healthy since it had nutritious amount of kale, sweet potatoes, onions, zucchini.  There is a sweet hint of coconut, along with the nuttiness of the ground peanuts.  This was so good I was super full from over eating because I couldn't stop spooning the sweet potato goodness into my mouth!

This had been on my list of vegan friendly places to eat for years, but I never got around to it for some reason or other. I can't believe I hadn't made this place more of a priority. The waiters were some of the most attentive I've had in years. Noticeably on top of their games. Me and my boyfriend went in for breakfast and everything was delicious. I had the vegan Biscuits and Gravy with Blackened Tofu, talk about multiple layers of delicious flavors and spice. Definately the best Biscuits & Gravy I have eaten since becoming vegan. SO delicious. The large portion came with two large biscuits, and it was enough for me to take half of my meal to go for lunch later. My boyfriend got the Chimichangas.After a few bites, he said that this is definately added to our list of places to eat regularly, and I agreed. I love "dual" places. Where I can eat delicious quality vegan food, and my boyfriend can eat eggs, meat, and cheese... so we're both happy.  Can't wait to go back.

This is my favorite vegan-friendly brunch spot in Chicago. It's got a little bit of everything food-wise, the portions are filling, they offer options for vegetarians and non-vegetarians, and I've never waited longer than 15 minutes or so to be seated.  My favorites on the menu are: -Fake chicken wrap -Pepito scramble with tofu -Vegan pancakes with fruit The service is always pretty great too. Keep it up, Handlebar!

I'm not even a vegetarian/vegan, but I'm really impressed by this place. The atmosphere is a little divey, but still seems clean, it's just like the walls have a story to tell. The art is a little funky, but really cool at the same time, like it all belongs exactly where it is. They have a back patio as well that is nice enough for a date, but not hip or trendy where you feel like you need to wear a collared shirt.  A really great spot to enjoy a day or night of nice weather. The food is great too, again as a meat-eater, I haven't had a bad meal there. I really like the fish tacos and the black bean tostadas are a great starter. I know us carnivores are always worried if vegetables are going to fill us up enough and believe me, it's plenty filling and you don't miss the flavor of meat. The kitchen knows where they are doing.  In the end it's a great place to have a quality, animal-friendly meal but you'll feel like you got a little of the city on you still. Worth traveling to for sure, but go in a small group (good for a date).

We were so excited to try the bloody mary, but none in our group found it anything to rave about.  The service was horrible (we had to bring our water carafe inside from the patio to have it filled up), our server never checked on us to see how our meals turned out, and our second round of drinks came after we had finished eating and didn't want them any more.  The manager didn't take the constructive criticism well, and I emailed the website (hoping to stumble upon the owner) and never got a response.  I'm so glad that business is so great that you don't need to treat your customers well because I certainly won't be coming back.
I'm giving the 5 stars for my single meal, the GROUND NUT STEW! Talk about amazing. Fulfilling and vegan too

Terrific spot off the beaten path. The menu is unique and everything is fresh and inventive. Love the pepito scramble. Really haven't had anything bad. I'm not a vegan, but I eat vegan and vegetarian here happily.  It would deserve five stars if the prices weren't a little inflated. I get that they use all fresh quality ingredients, but everything extra is a little too nickel and dime for my liking.  Patio is tops.
Great spot. This was my 3rd vegan restaurant ive been to. I ordered the Green Meanie sandwich and chili cheese fries. That sandwich was delicious and the fries were great.

Nice little bar with a good beer selection! Food isn't bad, too. The fish tacos are really good! A little hipster-y but what do you expect for the area? Been at this place a few times & believe you me I'll be going back.

LOVE this spot. They have an outdoor patio, so definitely make use of it during the summer (food+drinks outdoors= my idea of chill summer nights).  Food is solid and this place has an awesome menu selection (I seriously want to try everything that's on it). Oh, and they even serve breakfast until 3 pm, which is PERFECT for brunch lovers.

I actually did not even know that Handlebar was a vegan/vegetarian place until someone told me, but do not despair, fish and cheese lovers! You will find plenty of options on the menu! (Steak and bacon lovers, however, will have to find elsewhere to go.) This place is small and not particularly great for larger parties, but I love the intimate atmosphere. (However, be prepared to rub elbows with all the neighborhood hipsters...) The food is also pretty solid, and the bar has a good selection of beers. My faaavvoorite thing to order here is the fried pickles -- they come in spears with minimal but crunchy batter and vegan ranch -- absolutely divine! I also enjoyed the tuna sandwich.

Not a bad alternative/hipster burger joint. It's a little on the small side, but the burger selection had me go back a second time. They had a good selection of craft beers also . The service was also good.

I love handlebar. I always want to bring everyone I know there, but they are not veggies, so it is hard to convince.  It shouldn't be though as they have a great blend of vegetarian and fish options. .  Food: I love the maduro. It is what I get most often. It has a unique hearty texture and blend of spices.  I LOVE the breakfast chimichanga. Great queso and a crispy perfectly fried shell with lots of yummy stuffing inside.  I LOVE LOVE the gouda mac and cheese.  It is absolutely THE best mac and cheese i have ever had. EVER.  Seriously, just go and get this mac and cheese.  Atmosphere: I love the funky vibe inside and I LOVE the back patio. Of course with a patio like that and a great brunch selection, expect to wait, but that is not unique to Handlebar.  I was actually pretty impressed that they got us in in under an hour at peak brunch time on a Sunday.  The only thing that prevents me from a 5 star review is two fold.  Some of the dishes have been a miss. The grits were a little bland and dry. I lived in NC for a while, so I know how good cheesy grits can taste. Pumpkin seed pesto sounds amazing and interesting, but again kinda bland.   So my advice if you visit once and don't find your favorite dish, give 'em at least one more chance, and get the mac and cheese!

Love handlebar! Came here on a Thursday night with another couple and had a delicious experience.  There are so many meaty, vegetarian, vegan, and pescatarian options, my eyeballs almost fell out of my head.  I've had their nachos (absolute heaven) and ahi tuna burger before and was very impressed.  This time I tried the vegetarian chili cheese fries, vegetarian buffalo chicken wrap, and smoked mac and cheese.  Sweet baby Jesus, that mac and cheese was delicious!  The wrap and chili cheese fries were good, but the mac and cheese stole the show! Service was alright, prompt and helpful, but just not super friendly.  Whatever, if she dropped an F-bomb I'd probably still go back for the mac and cheese and nachos ;)

We waited an hour for brunch on Sunday but the wait was worth it! Our group started out with the chili cheese fries which were some of the best ive ever had! I ordered eggs sunny side up and the italian sausage seitan which was seasoned very well. The rest of the group ordered Vegan breakfast burrito, biscuits and gravy with two eggs.  All the food we ordered was delicious.   Go check this place out!  We will definitely be back!
Chicago tofu sandwich is awesome.  My girlie likes the everything green salad.  Sloppy Joe, oh yeah.  Mac and cheese is awesome too.
