Great choice!  It was 7pm on a saturday night and we were seated immediately.  There was a line for a table five minutes later!  Good timing!   Love the decor and the food I had.  I tried the black beans maduro and i cant imagine trying anything else there after that.  It was seriously one of the yummiest meals i have ever had!  i don't even know exactly what it was that i was eating..but DAMN!  With the seasonal beer I had this was perfect.  I will be coming back here time and time again.
Try the Green Meanie.  Try the smoked gouda mac 'n' cheese.  Try the soup.  Try the fake meat.  Optional: Don't worry about the fact that you don't have a bike.

this is one of my favorite places in wicker park. i really don't like going to wicker park as much as i use to, before it changed but this is one of the few places that will bring me there.  last time i was there i got 2 pitchers of dogfish head and ate bbq seitan and i didn't move for 2 hours. not only was i wasted but also in pure bliss.  the best thing i've had there was chorizo and black bean nachos. i've never had seitan chorizo, only soyrizo, and it was fucking amazing.  if i always had money, this would be my spot to blow it. i've heard the brunch is really awesome, but i've never had time to check it out but i'm looking forward to it soon. it's decently priced and the setup of the place is nice, but the service isn't that great but who cares. the food and drinks rule!!!

Don't be turned off by the "vegetarian" label, I'm a meat eater and this place is great!  I've eaten at Handlebar twice in the past week and it's quickly becoming one of my favorite dinner spots. The smoked gouda mac n' cheese is out of this world. Hands down the best mac n' cheese i've had in the city. The tuna steak sandwich with garlic aioli sauce is frigging ridiculously good. In addition to the food Handlebar has a great beer selection, good atmospheric vibe and good music. Price is ok, could be a little cheaper but not terribly expensive either.

For a vegetarian place, the Handlebar is a pretty satisfying meal - and this coming from a big meat eater.  The nachos are great, and the fish tacos are solid.  It's a bit pricey, but they have a good rotating selection of drafts, and good stable of bottled beer.  They also consistently play good music - everything from queen to queens of the stone age.       If you can stomach eating around hipsters, its definitely a good place. - also, pretty good art on the walls... at least lately.

i love this place.  several good vegetarian options, and a full bar.  i used to get the same thing every time but i highly recommend changing things up every now and then...you may find a new favorite (like that nutty stew thing).

I went here this early afternoon and enjoyed it greatly!  I had the Huevos Diablo, which is pretty much Huevos Rancheros.  Delicious.  Not really authentic Mexican version of the dish, but it was a great take on it.   Best part is that you can order a single slice of French Toast as a side order. Food was prompt service was friendly and the massive amount of bike hipsters was entertaining.  Good times.

Spot on fake meat.  A couple fish dishes to round out the mostly veg/vegan menu (esp. catfish tacos)  Everything is real fresh and good beers.  Like the 'pick 3 sides' option for lunch/dinner.  Easy parking on North Ave. most times of day.  Seasonal seating on back patio.  Great service, great place.

Good veggie/vegan selection, plus a nice beer menu. Place is fun and the decor is entertaining. I enjoying going on Sundays for immediate hangover relief. Word of warning, if you lack super tight clothes and multiple tattoos you will not fit in with the crowd. But don't let that stop you from trying Handlebar out.

I can't believe they put up with us here.  Nice location, nice people, great bike decor.  I heard whoever opened it stole the theme and name from someone else, but true or not, I am glad they opened up and have cheap beer and vegan breakfast for me and my wasted idiot friends.

Have I really never written a review for you before?  How can that be?  You have always treated me oh so well, filling my tummy with tasty dishes.  The gouda mac 'n cheese is the only mac 'n cheese I'll ever purchase when eating out.  Pair it with the chili and you've got yourself  some good winter comfort foods.  Thank you Handlebar for treatin' me so right.
Handlebar is great for creative vegan food, and the non-vegan smoked gouda mac and cheese is amazing.

Overall a good restaurant with good vegan food.  I would say that the prices are a tad expensive but not over-the-top.  And even though I enjoyed my vegan "chicken" buffalo wrap, it wasn't exciting enough to get again. I'm in no rush, but I will definitely come again - for the vegan options and the nice atmosphere.

I'm a breakfast restaurant fan, and this place is one of my favorites in the city.  The menu is well-planned with lots of fresh ingredients and vegetarian/vegan options that please even voracious meat eaters like myself.  I am addicted to the breakfast burrito with fresh spinach and avocado and the Handlebar salad with arugula, pears and parmesean is perfect for when I need something less heavy. Some of the dinner options are a bit starchy for my tastes, but the fake fried chicken can't be beat; it's great in both the fried 'chicken' salad and (especially) in the buffalo 'chicken' wrap. The side order of garlic mashed potatoes are just like my dad makes them, with the potato skins included in the mash.  Delicious. My biggest complaint about handlebar is that they tend to get unnecessarily aggro with the music.  I stopped going there at night a while ago because I got tired of the hardcore rock turned up to 11.  Lately, it seems their night staff has taken day shifts; because I've been brunching to Danzig the last couple of time I ate in. This makes me feel like I'm 60, but is too much to ask that you hold off on the heavy metal?   Ugh, those kids and their Metallica...

So yeah... Handlebar... it's pretty good... They have some vegan stuff. It's pretty good stuff. It is somewhere between moderate to a little expensive for what they serve. Not a huge menu. Service is good. They have a glorious selection of beer.  Yeah sure if I'm in the area.

I crave the Biscuits & Gravy insanely. Handlebar has good food, the only things I think are pricey are the pasta options. Specials are always tasty and the staff is nice. Usually a good beer selection and I have been there evenings to party, although brunch is my personal fave. I have a girlfriend that makes he guy bike up there on the weekends just for a vegan breakfast burrito to go. Mmm!

after calling flattop and realizing that they only have breakfast on saturdays and sundays (bad news on the friday after thanksgiving!), my boyfriend and i were trying to think of a place to go. we ended up at handlebar. he is a vegetarian and i'm not but we both enjoyed a delicious breakfast! i ordered huevos diablos and it was amazing. the chipotle sauce was spicy but not too over powering. my boyfriend ordered the breakfast burrito + fake meat chorizo and thought it was delicious. i had a much better tasting breakfast here than at a traditional "greasy spoon" restaurant. i'm sure i will return here again as it is a good choice for the both of us!

As if you need it, Handlebar! Another glowing review from a girl who was initially unimpressed, not by your enjoyable beer selection, but by the disgruntled bartender rambling about a punk graffiti artist tarnishing his good name and slamming the register repeatedly in frustration while forgetting to give us the free shots he promised.  However! upon a return mid-hangover, I was instantly cured by the biscuits and gravy which have become my favorite in all the land and have led to a new year's resolution to join a gym. A friend and I once spent hours out back over samosas, gumball head, fried plantains and pb&j pie. You are, without question, all that is good about my hipster infested neighborhood.

The faux fried "chicken" salad is wonderful.  For breakfast, try the vegetarian biscuits and gravy--delightful. I tend to get the same stuff every time I come here, but then I do that at every restaurant.

My boyfriend and I like to stop by Handlebar every month or so.  He loves the chili cheese fries and I adore the Buffalo Chick'n Wrap.  No food will satisfy you quite the same once you've tasted it.  Handlebar is very vegan-friendly while still offering some heavier + more familiar foods for those that get a bit freaked by vegetarian fare.  I can bring any one here; my mom, my friends, my cheese-loving boyfriend and everyone can find a satisfying, delicious dish.  Handlebar's decor is fine and the service is alright... but the food will keep you hooked.

My sis is vegetarian and dislikes going out to restaurants.  Great combo for a dinner companion.  Right.  Anyways I managed to bring her out to Handlebar after my taste pallet twin recommended the place.  The chips and dip starter wasn't too tasty.  Something about the chips wasn't right.  For the entrees she had the green meanie and I had the black beans maduro.  Both were awesome.  I loved the spiciness of the sauce in the maduro balanced with the sweet plantains.  What was more amazing was that my sis actually devoured her food for once.   Definitely a good sign.   I liked it so much that I went again.  I flipped the script a bit and had the fish tacos, which were top notch for Chicago.  My friend had the black beans maduro, but it wasn't as good as when I had it.  Disappointing.  I think it's a good place to check out vegetarian food that that tastes good for meat eaters.  Also, the patio in back is great in the summer.  I'm on the fence between giving this a 3 or 4.

I love Handlebar! Everything there that I've had is pretty great. And they have good drink specials. $3 whiskey drinks?  Yes please. Also great deals on good beer to go along with an excellent veggie friendly meal. The chili is dope. And all sandwiches are great too. And they have a place to lock up bikes up front! A++++++

Let me start this off by saying this is my favorite place to grab a bite and a drink in Chicago. I have been a regular for several years and the following are the pros and cons I've encountered. - I have been to this place probably 70+ times and have been served by the same people over and over again. The staff will never give a friendly nod, a hello, anything that shows these people have a personality. On three occasions I've been seated and waited about 20 minutes for the wait staff who were busty talking/hanging which resulted in me leaving. + The food is good. My personal faves are the buffalo chicken wrap and the nachos. If you are not a fan of the regular menu they offer several specials that change every week. They also have a very very good beer selection. (bells, three floyds, unibrou). - Sometimes the music is good. Sometimes you'll find yourself listening to van halen live or hot water music and think to yourself wtf. This also displays a lack of personality on behalf of the staff. + The summer patio is amazing. You can park your bike right in back and keep an eye on it if you do not feel like bringing a lock.

I had a really nice Saturday last weekend. One part was visiting the Handlebar (the other, the handmade market at the empty bottle!) I ordered the Ground Nut Stew. Now, it's hard for me not to compare to the Ground Nut Stew I enjoyed in Seattle's Pan African Cafe. But for a restaurant that's not all about African food, I thought it was really good. It managed to distinguish itself as perhaps a little more health conscious, with some greens and nuts thrown in.  My boyfriend ordered Seitan Filled tortellini. The concept alone of a nice vegan tortellini is pleasing, since it's not something you come across often.  I tried a bite and it was pretty good, and Chuck seemed happy.  Oh, and we also had coffee, which was really satisfying on a cold day. We were both tempted by the menu's mention of adding Kahlua, but at $4 we decided it was a little steep. But overall, nice comfy bar-type atmosphere with good music, and I like the variety on the menu. I'm sure we'll stop by again.

Handle Bar has a great selection of vegetarian and vegan options with several fish meals and cheeeese. (yum) I had a side salad and the side of gouda mac'n'cheese. Both were delicious but kinda small. Don't go here if you're starving or if you're craving a burger, you won't be satisfied.   I love the cozy atmosphere, the exposed brick wall and the art. Definitely worth a return visit.

I went there last night and had a pretty good experience. Everything was --for lack of a better word--"cool".  When I walked in I automatically felt really frumpy--like i stumbled into a cool kid exhibit at the field museaum. Specious Hipsterous. Anyway, most of the menu is vegitarian, and lots of the dishes have tofu or setian in it. The guys i was with were all "uhhh....you didn't say this was a vegitarian place..." But they calmed down after getting a few beers--which were 3 floyds--and if you haven't had a 3 floyds you probably should! They had some bowie blasting--which ruled--and i had a good time people watching. The food was really good--i got this big mother of a  vegitarian sandwich, and the guys got samosas and some plantain dish. The salads looked good-more like meal type salads with cheese and good stuff in it. The one thing that stood out was this hellova good pickle on the side of my sandwich--it must have been house pickled or something because it was the wildest pickle ever. It tasted like fresh dill, garlic, and something else uber good. I took a star off because my mashed potatos were on the luke warm side--but after a 12 hr shift in customer service i could really give a shit. They were still good cold. Oh yeah--i also saw some guy that looked just like orlando bloom. THAT was weird. So lets see...good food, not much meat, lots of beer, orlando bloom, bowie, and tollerable cool kids. Really good, not great--but I'll be back.

Okay, so it's a typical Sunday morning....and like most Sunday mornings I wake up with a skosh-bit of a hangover and an overwhelming need for mimosa and brunch-type-sustenance.  So a friend and I decided on Handlebar...a place I've been to once and had, oh, lets say 3-star worthy food (aka, neither good enough or bad enough to Yelp). But today, oh today, my friends....I shoulda brought another pair of socks, cuz Handlebar knocked 'em off! (that joke was way better when my Philosophy professor used it...). I was really in the mood for something different, something I wouldn't normally order so I decided on the Autumnal Tofu Scramble...cubed delicata squash, spinach, shoestring turnips (or parsnips...I always get those two confused), cubed tofu and candied pecans, all tossed in some kind of mystery sauce. I was a little leery of the dish, thinking there's just too much "stuff" going on here, but my gut told me to suck it up and go for it. All I can say, is my gut was right!  There was a lot of stuff going on, sweet, savory, and some tastes right in-between....there was a variance in textures too, which I loved and was especially set-off by the crunchy deliciousness of the candied pecans. Seriously, if it's on the specials when you go there, order it, you won't be sorry! Quick rundown on the rest of the important little facts: Breakfast potatoes: excellent Coffee: pretty damn good Mimosa: tasty treat Vegan french toast: pretty tasty and had a yummy, malty taste to it..was a bit tough and burnt though Service: busy but decent, could have been more attentive but wasn't rude.

I was recently turned on to this place by a friend and I am very grateful.  No matter what your preference herbivore, carnivore, or...like me...alchovore then I high recommend checking this place out.  The vegetarian and vegan dishes are really innovative and tasty.   The service has always been friendly to me and their bloody mary almost counts as a full meal!  I also recommend the mac and cheese...it's tha cheesiest.

Since I've been in Chicago for 9 months now, I really have no business getting lost.  But to be fair, I come from SF.  A small city that can be mastered in a day for even the most navigationally challenged people. So, tonight, I offered to pick up a good friend and bring her along to my favorite spin class.  After getting ridiculously "turned around" (who is the engineer behind that logan square area???)....we had already missed half the class.   I was feeling like a stranger in a strange town...stressed, homesick and hungry, and pissed that we missed our class.   Sensing my frustration with getting lost in a city built on a freakin' grid....and feeling  completely inadequate when every single person around me seemed to know north, south, east and west, when you're not even NEAR the lake (and only gives directions in those terms)...topped with the fact that I refuse to give up my old school nokia phone with no sort of internet access, let alone GPS navigation, my lovely companion suggested Handlebar.  My only requirement was that it served alcohol. It ended up completely turning around my night.  It was a small place, but you knew it was going to be good by the size of the crowd (obviously locals).  Everyone who worked there was polite, and friendly, but not artificial.   The Pinot Noir they have was excellent.  The fish tacos were excellent.  Really very good.  I would give it 5 stars, but it was just a bit pricey for what it was.  If it was a tad more reasonably priced, I imagine there would be a line around the block...so they've probably found a balance for what works for them.  But my guess is once I explore the city more thoroughly (seems like a seriously never ending task)....I'll either find a much-cheaper-just-as-delicious-grilled-catfish-taco.  Or,  I'll find a just-as-delicious-version-at-the-same-price-at a fancy-pants-lets-get-dressed-up-and-go-out joint.    So much of life is about timing....and I was glad i met this place on this particular night.\ Guess it depends what you're in the mood for.  But finding good seafood is important.

Best Mac n' Cheese in the City.  I will crave it the rest of my life.  This is my favorite vegetarian eatery in the city.  As the name implies the whole place is bicycle themed.  Big hipster scene here.  Always delightful beers on tap and a drink special every day.  I recommend the African Nut Stew.  Great outdoor garden seating during warmer months.  Be warned the place can get crowded.  Bike on over why don't ya.

I'd have to say this is by far my fiance's and I favorite restaurant to go to. Whats not to love about homestyle healthy foods and some BEER.  Their seitan knocks Chicago Diner to the curb and their Strawberry Soup is surprisingly yummy(seasonal item).  This are averaged priced and even if you're not a hipster or bike loving person you can still get the grub with out the snub.  Wait time is usually none, and in the not so frigid months of Chicago they have an outdoor patio out back.  Try the "Chicken" Wrap or the Meanie Greenie Sandwich mMMM!

When I feel like dusting off the old chaps and taking the hog out for a good spin ('65 Schwinn Stingray)  I'll cruise on over to Handlebar looking for a dame to share this banana seat. Great sausage. Yours, M. Pleasure

Dear Handlebar, When my sister moved nearish to you, she said doing a search on "vegetarian" near her address turned you up.  Our parents didn't want to visit on moving day, so we didn't.  Then I read reviews on Yelp.  I wondered if I would be judged harshly for not wearing my hipster awesome cred on my sleeve while in your presence.  Jen and I put off our initial visit for a few weeks, but then one night the opportunity struck.  We needed takeout, and you delivered... though not literally.  Man, that would have been sweet.  BBQ Seitan heaven.  Smoked gouda mac n cheese, garlic mashed potatoes.  My mouth waters just remembering it.  And then I introduced you to my boyfriend.  And he loved you too, but you have more than enough love to share, so there was no weirdness or jealousy.  That was really cool of you.   Now you've become part of our veg/veg-heavy restaurant rotation.  And I only feel mildly self conscious visiting while in my work day wear.  All of your employees have been super awesome.  Genuinely nice, or just quiet.  Either is fine with me.  Just spare me the fake nice.  If nothing excites you more than taking my order, I pass judgement on you in a not nice way.  But I digress.   I don't know what people are saying about your food being pricey.  You're right there with Chicago Diner, Blind Faith, and Heartland as far as price goes.  Sure, it'd be pretty sweet if every meal cost $0.02, but then you wouldn't be in business very long, and I would be denied your black bean maduro.  In short, tragic. Sincerely,  K

A bit pricey, but the Green Meanie was delish and big enough for two meals. I was with my vegan friend so I did it total veg and added vegan mayo and no cheese. I'd like to go back and try the mac n cheese and some desserts.  The waiter did seem a little crappy. When I asked what sides were vegan, he said all of them. "Even the mac"? "Well, anything that says Cheese obviously isn't vegan"... sorry, I thought they had invented vegan cheese. *wipes tear* He then got a lecture from my vegan friend after he said the cooks didn't like cooking with Vegan cheese. So I guess we're even.

I love meat.  Bloody. Well done. Pink.  As long as it mooed, oinked, squaked or put up a fight.  So, I am usually skeptical of meat-free menu's.  That said, I loved the food here.  Everything is very flavorful and hearty and will fill'er up. I'd like to see a few more options on the menu but the Green Meanie was fantastic and the smoked Gouda Mac'n'Cheese... my mouth is watering just thinking about it. This ain't no rabbit food.  This is a carnivore's vegetarian restaurant.  Great beer too!

Handlebar is a-ok as my stars indicate. The food is kinda overpriced, considering that everything is made of vegetables or tofu. $9 seems like a lot for a sandwich with tofu and spinach. The best thing I've had was the chili quesadilla, which was tasty but not really healthy. The beer selection is  kinda boring. The service is ok. Decor is ok, but it's a smaller place. I will probably go back, but there are so many better options for vegetarian in the area. It seems like people like it because its the "cool" spot in the area, and there isn't another place that caters to the bike crowd.  I think that I have a personal mental block that keeps me from loving Handlebar because I worked for several years at a similar vegetarian cafe that was AWESOME.  The food, the beer selection, the price everything was better.  I guess if you're ever in Boston, you should go to the Other Side. Maybe I'm just homesick?

IMPRESSED!!! I am NOT a vegetarian; buffalo wings are my favorite food. I don't eat beef or pork though, so I hang out with some herbivores every once in awhile. This menu makes me forget about meat honestly. I went for brunch and had the breakfast burrito and a side of cheese grits (yum!). My two quasi-vegan friends both had the bbq seitan sandwich which was huge and by their accounts really good. The black beans were super flavorful too. The menu in general seems to be almost "southern" or "soul food" inspired with other items like biscuits and gravy (seitan sausage of course) and gouda mac and cheese. The coffee was strong, but full o' flavor. The restaurant definitely has that hipster feel you often get west of Damen. Abstract fun art on the walls, older cute seating, etc. This place is great for both vegetarians and meaties! I'll be here again for sure!

Handlebar is hands down my favorite restaurant in Wicker Park. Since it don't eat eggs, it rules out a lot of the brunch items from many of the "vegetarian-friendly" places in the area, but Handlebar has great vegan french toast and decent scrambled tofu. Brunch-wise, the biscuits and gravy are great, though the biscuits are a little heavy for my taste. My favorite is the vegan diablos, with little homemade corncakes, seitan chorizo, scrambled tofu, black beans, brown rice, and diablo sauce. Since I eat dairy, I get it smothered with jack cheese and sour cream too, but it's almost as good without. The new southern breakfast is also great, with collard greens, scrambled tofu (or eggs, if you like those), succotash, and cheddar grits. Sandwich-wise, my favorite by far is the vegan buffalo wrap. The BBQ seitan is always a classic, and the marinated tofu is good, but not as good as the rubbed and grilled tofu it replaced. The also had a marinated seitan sandwich for a short while recently that was amazing, but sadly it got bumped from the menu. Entrée-wise, I really like the tortellini, but the best entrées tend to be the specials, which change weekly. I've never been disappointed by these. Desserts aren't especially great, but I am a fan of the vegan fried pies. Fillings also change from time to time. The pecan is my favorite, so I'm hoping that comes back soon. The beer menu is great, with a revolving selection of microbrew drafts as well as a wide selection of bottles. I highly recommend trying a beermosa for brunch. Yes, this is beer and orange juice. It sounds weird, it tastes amazing. I would never feel bad about recommending Handlebar.

I have eaten almost everything* on the menu at Handlebar. It's not just that I live five short blocks away and this place is great to take everyone from parents to out-of-town pals who want a taste of Chicago. It's that it's all amazing. The beer selection is large. Not Map Room large, but large enough to stand on its own. The waiters know which beers go in which glasses -- a handy feat -- and can tell you about the beers if you ask. That's fairly rare for a restaurant of this price range. Personal favorites include the Green Meanie, which is refreshing and fresh and just the thing after you've had a weekend of unhealthy food/drink and want to feel both full and not horrible, the bbq seitan sandwich, which is perhaps more than any one human can consume, the breakfast burrito, a perfect mesh of burrito-ly goodness and everything one wants in a breakfast, and the gazpacho, when they have it. The only thing I can't really get behind is the smoked gouda mac n cheese. It's tasty all right, and far more wholesome than your average box of Kraft, but its smoked flavor tends to overpower and make it taste like a plate of smoked in pasta form, rather than the smoke being a tertiary element to the cheese and macaroni. That said, I'm still giving Handlebar five stars. It's just that delicious. * I am a vegetarian, thus I do not eat fish. All the pesco things on the menu are alien to me, but my dad had the fish tacos and will vouch for their awesomeness. Except he's not on yelp.

I love this place. There are several items on the menu that I crave: buffalo chic'n wrap, the nachos, gouda mac n cheese...but I think one of their best features is their ever-changing beer list. Unlike at a bar, here I drink beer for the taste of it, and the ones on their specials list always complement their food.  Its great to go in the summer with friends when the back patio is open. For vegetarians who like seitan, veggie sausage and other comfort foods, this is the place for you. Chicago dinner probably has the best selection of this type of food, but Handlebar is way cooler (I think).  It also doesn't have photos of a guru or fuzzy animals which some of the other veggie places have.  They also have one or two fish dishes, and the nachos have fooled some meat-eaters I know, so you don't have to be vegetarian to like the food here.

A decent, though expensive "healthy" and "vegetarian" place in Wicker Park that seems to attract everything from annoying hipsters to even more annoying breeders (with a few decent folk in between).  Wait staff is sometimes slow but generally friendly.  They have a nice outdoor patio in the spring and summer. The only problem is...The food. It's not the portions, though you do tend to get less than you pay for, but the usual absence of taste. That said, their macaroni is quite good and their sides meal is the best deal there. An OK place to go if you're desperate, but nowhere to go out of your way for.

A new favorite for casual & delicious dining. Awesome menu for vegetarians and vegans but there are a few fish options and enough hearty choices to keep a carnivore happy. I had the BBQ seitan sandwich on multigrain; the BBQ sauce is perfectly spicy and the vegetable soup with quinoa is flavorful without being too salty.  Collard greens on the side are heavy on the garlic but not overcooked and still a bit crunch--YUM!!  Can't wait to go back...

Seitan Tortellini excellent. Light sauce with asparagus, cherry tomatoes and  parmesan. Breakfast burrito, potato, spinach, egg and avocado is divine. Great micro-brew selection, pumpkin ale is in season! I always have an excellent experience. Love Handlebar. Bring a friend and enjoy.  t

I will forever remember eating succotash there for breakfast, because I was in the early stages of labor.  Who eats succotash?  Apparently, me.  It's really good! But that being said, this is a consistently amazingly yummy place to eat, breakfast or lunch/dinner. Then you add on the fact that their beer list is amazing. Then you add on the fact that they have splendid desserts. It's nearly perfect, but it's crowded when they don't have outdoor seating, and pretty loud, too.

Wow. So my friend's a vegan and back before her vegan days we enjoyed many of the same restaurants.  It was time for a catch-up night and and I asked her to pick a place that she could enjoy a vegan friendly meal while I could eat real cheese.  I trust her recommendations but I'll admit I was a little wary of this vegan friendly divey bar type place. HOLY CRAP was I wrong.  I think I had one of the best meals I have had in a loooong time.  I was instantly enticed by the Gouda Mac & Cheese and I was steering away from anything with seitan or tofu.  I decided to go for the yellowtail tuna sandwich with a side of the mac & cheese. It was hands down one of the best in my life.  The tuna was cooked PERFECTLY to a medium rare and sliced.  It came with sunflower sprouts and some greens and a savory garlic aioli on perfectly toasted multigrain bread.  The gouda mac & cheese was hot and super creamy with the perfect flavor. I cannot wait to go back and try some other things on the menu.  The portions were big and all the food coming out around us looked delish! As for the atmosphere, the bar is a hike away from any trains but I will definitely bring my bike to solve that next time.  The beer garden type setting in the back was nice decorated (for an outside spot) and a great place to have a relaxing dinner.  Overall the vibe was very laid back and made for the perfect weeknight spot.

i mentally bookmarked this place a few weeks ago and finally convinced my bf to take a trip with me after work friday. we were hungry and tgif-ing so hard we decide to order nachos while drinking and waiting for food.  i probably would have given this place four stars if it weren't for the nachos. those bitches were the best tasting thing i've had in a while. bf and i fought over the soggy king nachos hidden with the chorizo + peppers + onions + tomatoes pile of awesome. so good we took the remainders home with us when we couldn't finish them - and who takes nachos home to eat as leftovers? typically grossest decision ever. don't judge us. we enjoyed them on my couch the next morning. we didn't care that they were all a soggy mess. a yummy soggy mess.
Very veggie friendly menu (samosas + herbed tofu sandwich recommended!) and super cute waitstaff. Enchante.
Too bad I can't live closer, otherwise I would be here everyday. I tried the Southern Plate (cheesy grits, eggs, collard greens, succotash..) and it was divine!!

Funny. Everyone I know looooooooves this place. I went once....and it sucked big time.  My sandwich was over seasoned to make up for the lack of taste. BUT i decided to give it another try  a year later or so. Afterall, everyone kept telling me how wonderful it was.  So I went another time. Bland ass food. and  the friend i went with wasn't impressed either. never again.

I really love this place.  Its only too bad I live on the other side of the city so I don't get to visit as often but every time I do the experience is great.  I am usually greeted for a table before I even get to the 'Wait to be seated' sign.  The servers are always informative and cooperative with any questions a member of our group may ask.  They have a great selection of beer and the foods are a great pairing.  They always have a daily special, including Messenger Mondays.  So if you are a bike messenger be sure to stop by on Mondays to get an extra bonus.  The portions are so huge that I can barely finish them.

"They want to meet us where?" I had a bad feeling about this. I wanted to see my friends, but I thought that their choice of bar was way off. I'm all for no meat and drinking beer. In fact I've been doing that for many years now. But usually I try to distance myself from establishments that cater to this type of demographic (sorry guys).  Shoulders dropped and head down, I went to the bar. I ordered the Sunday drink special- lemonade and vodka pint, $5 and an order of fries. Second drink- bourbon and coke.  I ended up walking out having a great time. This was due to the company with me, the nice drinks, and the great service that we got. Rock-on.

Upon moving walking-distance from Handlebar after not having been for over a year, I found that I really, really like this restaurant more than I remembered.  More vegan options on the menu now, large portions, delicious foods.  I've had the vegan diablos for brunch, which I loved, and also tried the vegan biscuits and gravy which were tasty, but not sausage-y enough for my liking.  Fried chickn salad is superb, even better with wing sauce on the side. The groundnut stew is out of HAND and will be responsible for my gaining at least 50 pounds this winter - I can't wait.   And big fucking ups to those little PBJ fried pies.  Sweet baby jesus, goddamn. The waitstaff is almost ALWAYS super duper awesome - very friendly and accomodating.  They recognize and greet me with a smile.  Except for one certain server.   I encountered said server for the first time on my most recent visit there, and the service was so atrocious it was actually funny - I could have sworn we were being taped for some wonky realty tv show or something.  I mean, seriously.  Where did you go, dude?  I know taking our order was visibly exasperating and soul-draining for you...maybe you needed to take a nap between bringing us our drinks and FINALLY coming back to pick up the check.

In a perfect world I would live above the Handlebar where I could lower a bucket down to the servers and pull up a trifecta of Smoked Gouda Mac-n-Cheese, Buffalo "Chicken" Wrap and an Alpha King.  After I finished that I would drop the bucket back down and dig into some Cheddar Grits, Plantains, Black Beans Madura and maybe a little Green Meanie with an OS Tallboy.  In this perfect world I would also be a blubbering fatass but wouldn't give a shit because Handy is that good. Abridged Version: Nice prices for alcohol, consistently amazing food and unpretentious waitstaff.

Oh Handlebar, Oh handlebar! Much pleasure thou can'st give me; Oh Handlebar, Oh handlebar! Thy Specials are so unchanging. If you're a bike freak, Handlebar is for you. Do not drive here. Ride. Pull in the alley at the back and park in the suite of racks there. Saunter to your favorite iron table on the patio. Slip outta your messenger bag. Adjust your little biker hat. And order a luscious pint of amber goodness. Relax. Eat vegan. Drink in what's left of Chicago Bohemia (you are only 5 blocks from the ruins of the Busy Bee where Chicago's old hipsters ate Polish and ran a tab in the 80's).  You're preserving a lifestyle. You're eating healthy. You're saving money. You're not on Rush Street eating beef and gagging on Viagra, silicone, and Paul Mitchell Sculpting Gel. You got here on your speedie wheeled steed. The Patio is perfect. The EL clatters softly down at Milwaukee. Your chortling cohorts are chatting a clever line on art or liberal politiks or their silly young loves. Have dessert. Ask the waiter where he's from. Tip big - the difference between 15 and 25% isn't more than a dollar or two - you foot dragging skinflint.  OK. Why not 5 stars? A little more variety on the Specials (though the ones they have are inventive) and please get my drink order within two minutes of seating me. I'm thirsty.   Thanks Handlebar for helping make my Summer in Chicago joyful and healthy.

Mimosa's and veg. breakfast burritos with fresh ingredients. ... what more do you need on a Sunday. This is the perfect place for a good vegetarian brunch. The outside area is perfect for lounging a drinking some beer. This place is a great find!

Being that this place is just through the woods and over the bridge from my porch-  I always end up here when no one in my circle can decide where to go. Is it good? Yep.   Is it slow? yep.  (Dont go when you are in a hurry.  But then again, it aint wendys.) Are the drinks fat? oh hells yes, (And sometimes I need a vodka before noon.  And no one here will judge me.) Not a fan of the chili- although I am from texas, where all chili kings are born.  But I always enjoy their soup specials, and my fella goes crazy for their nachos (ask for an extra side of the verde salsa)

(Sorry, longest review ever but worth finishing) This is a letter that I sent to the owner today: I have been repeatedly patronizing your establishment for about 5 years.  I typically come in once every one or two weeks.  I usually enjoy the food and the service had historically ranged from passable to good. However, several years back I began to notice a new employee.  He usually seems to be behind the bar, but often serves as well (tall, thin, buzzed hair).  He is, by far the worst server I have ever encountered.  He is rude, smug, and does his job VERY poorly.   Over the years I have been served by him many times and each time have come away with a new depth of the absurdity of his service.  However, this past Friday (Aug 29th) absolutely topped all previous experiences and has possibly led me to consider not coming back. I had been talking to an out-of-town friend about Handlebar over the years and so when she came to visit this weekend, we were excited for her to try it.  Unfortunately it ended up being little more than an embarrassment for me.  We of course had my *favorite* waiter to begin with.  He was his typical dismissive self.  When he approaches a table, he does not greet anyone; he merely stands there staring at you with a disgusted look in his eye waiting for you to beg for food and drinks.  We were able to order ONE drink from him and our food.  Following this we never saw him again except for when he dropped off our burnt sandwiches (which was a first for me at Handlebar).  I thought better than to even consider sending them back since he surely strikes me as the type who would retaliate in some manner.   Then I made repeated attempts to get another round of drinks.  He came through our section several times but actually noticeably and purposefully IGNORED me as I tried to flag him down.  Finally about 40 minutes after receiving our food, I had to get up and walk up to the bar where I said to someone else "Since I cannot get anymore drinks or service of any kind, can at least pay so that I can leave?" Our smug waiter appeared shortly, made a PATHETIC apology which was more of an insult than anything else, and that was it. Let me summarize by saying that it is this man's attitude that ruins the experience.  I understand that slow service happens occasionally, but when I leave a restaurant actually feeling BAD (unwelcome, unsatisfied), that is unacceptable.  Hilariously, I went on Yelp to read reviews of Handlebar as I considered writing one myself, and found several that mentioned this same waiter.  He clearly feels that he's too good to serve, and there for, he should not.   I would highly recommend that you address his attitude with him and the affects that it has on your business. Sincerely, Crystal  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- I've always likes this place and it's a darn shame that this one awful guy ruins it for people.  And you know me...if you don't bring me my drinks, you're dead in the water.  Hopefully he is "dealt with" in some manner one of these days or gets a job as a Rocket Scientist so he can get the respect he so adamantly feels he deserves! --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- UPDATE*********  WIthin a few hours, the owner responded with a very nice and accomodating note promising to address the issue.  My faith is renewed.

I like the patio, the beer selection, the food. I don't love it, but I like it. Nothing here makes me gasp, feel faint and overwhelmed with excitement when I walk in. But then again... nothing about this place makes me want to punch people either. The tostadas are pretty good. I also enjoyed the buffalo chicken wrap. I would say a vast majority of the menu is vegetarian friendly but not in a boring way that would make your carnivorous friends mad that you dragged them along.

I loved it here today - to me this is Karyn's (nicer decor wise) meets Pick Me Up (diverse menu for those who aren't vegan) mixed with the Chicago Diner (we recognized several of their old waitstaff here and there are lots of vegan choices and they have local art on the walls) but better! I had the spinach salad with a tangy balsamic vinagrette (loved it, and I haven't found a good one in a while), the Tortellini - also quite delicious - a mellow, fresh flavor, we also had the Seitan BBQ Sandwich - so good because I am tired of the same BBQ (and other sauces that are used on every dish at Karyn's, this was unique and sweet, almost like short ribs), the entree that is first fried Plantains or something - soooo good, until I got to the bottom layer and found out that the sauce fell off of a fire engine (a little too spicy for me, but still very flavorful).  We had the Tomato Soup, Fries and Garlic Mashed Potatoes (an actual potato mashed, scrumptious with all the nutritious skin smashed in).  For dessert I had to try the Chocolate Raspberry Tart - OMG! I think I may ask my husband to drive the 45 minutes each way at night when I get a craving.  This was vegan dessert at its best, something you would expect in a high end, non-veg (maybe French?) restaurant, so delicate, yet sumptious, and a perfect mix of chocolate, nuts and raspberry sauce. We will definitely be back here!!

i spilled my beer and felt really bad, but the bartender joked, "you're the first person to spill on this counter," while filling my beer fully (even though i had drank some of it). had vegan buffalo "chicken" sandwich (8.95).  OMG.  so effing good.  i also splurged and got the gouda mac and cheese (dollar extra).  so did 3 of the other 5 people i was with!  it was amazing. i hate pricey food, but when it's this good, i don't mind paying.  i'm just really sad they don't have the wasabi tofu anymore. i wanted to try the tortellini they were advertising, but it was 12.95.  maybe next time. tip:it gets really busy.  try going on a "low" day.  tuesday was really nice.

This place never lets me down. The food is fairly priced and amazing (Green Meanie and Gouda Mac n' Cheese especially), the beer selection is enough to offer variety but not so much that you ignore the company you came with just to scope it out.  The service has always been attentive and never messed up an order. The outdoor patio is a HUGE plus.  Really, just not enough great things to say about it.

If this place had been around the corner from the house I was staying at, I would have eaten here three meals a day.  That includes beer because I think beer is an all day sort of beverage.   And furthermore, this is what I wished my food at Karyn's Cooked had tasted like.  Everything was fresh, not too heavy, with each ingredient allowed to stand out on it's own.  The mac and cheese was a hit - despite that I'm usually a baked mac n cheese girl rather than a creamy mac n cheese girl.  Though frankly, I've never really met a cheese I didn't like.     Of all the places I ate in Chicago this past weekend, this was the place that felt the most like me.

Vegan breakfast burrito = heavenly. They do vegan chorizo better than anyone I know. My dad is vegan so naturally this is his favorite restaurant. The patio is perfect and that tostada appetizer is mighty tasty.  I love bikes, too. Kudos on the bar stools made out of bike wheels/tires.  Cute boys are always a plus. They have those too. You should go.
An introduction to dining 101 I love salad. + I love Indie Rock + I love places close to home - I don't have a bike = I love Handlebar Get the "Everything Green Salad"

I went and, on a whim, ordered a Green Meanie and mashed potatoes. It could just be my palate, but the Green Meanie tasted like earth. As if I scooped up some ground and ate it. It just wasn't very flavorful, and I've had similar ingredients in other dishes and enjoyed them heartily. The mashed potatoes were good, however. The service was fine, and it was a laid back lunch, which I thoroughly enjoyed. The prices are definitely reasonable.

I can't get enough of Handlebar.  I jones for it if I go for more than a week without a Green Meanie (avocado madness) and a side of their delicious garlic mashed potatoes.  There are always interesting specials, and you can't go wrong with any of the menu stand-bys.  The beer selection is fantastic, with new selections popping up all the time.  I have tried most of Chicago's other vegetarian hot-spots (Chicago Diner?? Ugh, so bland) and Handlebar is the only place that I go back to regularly.  The staff is great.  Belly up to the bar sometime and introduce yourself or grab a table and chill.  My favorite restaurant in Chicago, hands down.

Handlebar is the closest bar/restaurant to the condo that my fiance and I recently purchased.  And as luck would have it, it is amazing!  For one thing, my fiance is a vegetarian and I am not.  Handlebar is the one place we can go to where we are guaranteed to both leave satisfied.  The food is amazing.  I have enjoyed every item I have ordered so far.  And the brunch!  Its absolutely delicious.  And to top it off, the Handlebar's beer menu is the best around.  This joint has quickly become our favorite restaurant in Chicago.

had be some black bean tostadas Was pretty good besides the fact that they put way way to much cilantro. yeah it is pretty loud in here when it gets late but it is a bar so what do you expect? for being a so called Bike messenger hangout, I suspiciously didn't see a lot of people pull up on bikes.....

I'm sorry to say that what first lured me to Handlebar was a crush on a bike messenger (oh you know you've been there too).  He took me there for brunch one morning and I got the vegan french toast.  Best french toast ever.  For lunch, I enjoy their herb tofu sandwich.  Mmm.  My crush on that messenger may have waned, but my love for Handlebar is still going strong five years or so later.

Consistently good food with an excellent selection for vegetarians. The Black Beans Maduro is spicy and super delicious, and the nachos with the faux chorizo are dreamy. The vegetarian biscuits and gravy can't be beat.  The beer list is good and changes seasonally. They usually have some Unibroue, Three Floyds, and New Belgium beers on tap. The service is either good or bad; there's really no in between. If the service were better, I'd give it five stars.
Just go and get the Greeny Meany and wash it down with a Gumball Head...then you'll know.  (Though I do confess that I feel like an ass when I drive there.)
Five stars for the Chipotle Maple (?) Tempeh Sandwich. One star for my confusion, as I didn't think I liked tempeh.
This place is great.  The food is excellent.  The atmosphere rocks.  No problems with the service.  What's not to love.

The first time I went there it was delicious but the service sucked. The second time I ordered the same thing which was something with eggs I can't remember name, but it wasn't good. The service was even worse the 2nd time. Went back, and I don't know why but the only consistent good thing is the sopes with refried beans and avocado and green salsa. Everything else was blah!

even though i'm quite obviously not a member of the hipster bike-riding demographic this place tends to serve (i don't have a beard, and i [hope] i look like i've showered recently), the staff was pleasant--but not overbearing.   i really enjoyed the fact that they supplied us with a small pitcher of water, as i tend to drink it faster than my server can fill it.  the blackened catfish and garlic mashed potatoes were tasty, and the mac n cheese was top notch.  i must add: my date's buffalo chicken wrap was the dopeness.  that shit tasted just like chicken--f'real.   way to go hipster white kids!

I love Handlebar!  I typically go for brunch, though it is open for dinner as well, and also serves as a bar (extensive beer selection!) in the evening hours. I highly recommend the huevos diablos (or the vegan version), though it sucks that avocado is extra. Prices are very reasonable, the bike-themed decor (and crowd) is kitchy and interesting, but not too overdone, and the large back patio is a treat during the warmer months.

i love the outdoor seating area. it's very laidback, usually seems like a fun crowd who frequents the place. inside is pretty sunny and nice in the front during the day. we had tall white robotman for a waiter. among a few mediocre dishes, he served us the handlebar special salad, a four ingredient salad which is usually pretty great, but forgot the main ingredient that would possibly make the salad worth the excessive $10. there were no pears on top of a walnut, parmesan, and dressed salad. heeelllloooooooo.   he didn't realize this of course because he was too busy flirting with a girl down aways and figured the waterboys would take care of his tables. after a long wait, we started asking other staff to help us when my friend i was with asked, again, for the beer he still had not received when others arriving after us were almost on their way to drunken states, the man said NOTHING (maybe he grunted once?), turned around (still no eye contact), and finally brought something out.  he never checked on us, nor pretended to care how our meal/drinks were. we must've really cramped his style, we didn't know we shouldn't go in there while he was on a roll with said girl (who must NOT have been able to hear what he was saying, he was a real dud so the loudness level worked for him).  i used to go here more because i'm a bicycle lover, but i can't stand to get that kind of crappy service, where the waiter thinks hes doing you a favor for just listening to your order. i can appreciate hipster fashion, but i am SO done with rude, cooler than thou hipster attitude.

I was recently brought here by a vegan friend and I must say that this is a great example of veggie dishes that could win over the carnivore in all of us.  I had the BBQ Seitan sandwich and the smoked gouda mac and cheese, plus bites of a friend's tofu sandwich and I drooled over the samosas on the next table.  Everything looked great or tasted great and was fairly reasonable in price.   I'd say their beer selection was good, but not expansive.  Certainly enough to satisfy the beer snob in me. The wait staff was friendly to us, and went out of their way to accommodate an awkwardly sized group (7), but were clearly not professional waiters.   I would recommend this for a mixed vegetarian and non-vegetarian group who is looking for a casual bar dining experience, but sick of bar food.  An excellent example of how great casual dining can be with just a little effort and imagination.
I love this place. I recently became a "vegetarian" (i still eat seafood) and this place is right up my alley. They have the best "chili cheese fries" ever! Great beer selection as well.

I was delighted to find this place. Actually, I've been driving by it for years but had no idea it was vegan/vegetarian friendly until Tuesday night when I joined a vegan friend here for dinner.  I swooned over the smoked gouda mac & cheese as well as the vegan chocolate raspberry tart . I also ate the bbq seitan sandwich which was yummy but really huge.. not a bad thing but I needed to make room for dessert. I'll definitely be coming back to try their booze and garden.

Yum yum yummy vegetarian food, although the faux meat dishes are hit or miss.  The seitan ravioli realllly falls short, but the fried chik wrap made me laugh out loud. Extra points for being one of the first in the city to bring Bell's (Kalamazoo brewing) back!!!!!! ps If you have remote disdain for hipsters, save yourself the bitch fest and go elsewhere.

We didn't make the cut here [frowny face]. Turns out we just didn't have enough ink or facial hair. Or maybe it was the "Fuck You, Hipster" t-shirt my friend was wearing. I don't know. For some reason our server was just not into, eh, what's the word?... Oh yes, "serving". When it came time to pay the bill it got even worse. He straight up disappeared. I'm talking Benjamin Linus waking up in the desert type shit. For his sake, I hope our server knows how to disarm horsemen with AK-47s and I hope he made  a reservation at the finest hotel in Tunis. For six years from now.  The food is pretty good veggie-oriented stuff. Far from your typical bar fare. The beer list looks nice and the back patio is quite solid. I might come back and give it another shot sometime. But not with Hurley. He'd be so pissed!

i'm hooked on this place. the beer selection is above average, the food is always great, they update their menu often enough to keep it interesting (even for someone who's there almost weekly), and the service has been nearly flawless for me, barring maybe twice when they were slammed.  granted the bike-nerd schtick of the clientele might be a bit much for some people (not me, though, as i'm a bike nerd myself), but hey, bike culture is at a peak right now, so it can only get less goofy from here (right?). that said, by no means does anyone here care if you're a bike aficionado or not, which is refreshing, as i'd hate to see a place as great as this be vexed with the fickle scenester factor.  there's a good sized outdoor patio, too, which is ideal for summer days when it's not 95+ outside. the aforementioned marvelous beer selection -or a bloody mary- is best enjoyed out here.  the menu is almost entirely vegetarian, save for a couple of items. and most of those veggie selections are easily vegan-ified. the staff knows their stuff, and can give you sound recommendations on the food as well as their beers.  inside, which is fine anytime, but particularly nice and cozy in the winter, there's always music in the background, ranging greatly, and you'll hear something from time to time that you just wouldn't hear at most places (i have a found memory of eating brunch hungover one morning while listening to turbonegro. the only other place i know of where i can do that is at home). paintings on the walls rotate, and the place is just generally inviting.  i'm at handlebar more than any other restaurant in town, and the few things that make it for me are the vegan options, the beer selection, and the staff.

I've heard whispers about this place many times before actually going, so the anticipation was built slightly.  Being the site of my first yelp meetup, handlebar was at an advantage as all my fellow yelpers were in good spirits and very welcoming.  As for handlebar, the food was great, which always surprises me when I order vegetarian.  We sat outside and it couldn't have been a more beautiful day to do so.  Being a bike nut myself the decor was right up my alley, and the outdoor seating has this wonderful hidden garden of eden feeling to it.  Service was lacking with me occasionally having to flag down our server to get another 1.75 PBR and eventually as night fell, we had to go to the bar to get our drinks. Despite the service I still had a great time, got to meet the Maggies (talk about friendly!) and went to sleep with that perfect equilibrium of drunkenness and sleepiness.

I love meat: cow, chicken, turkey, pig, fish, deer, buffalo, rabbit, duck, ostrich, snapping turtle, quail, and I have even eaten snake before. If my love for meat was only marginal, a few meals from this place would easily convert me to a herbivore. I am basing this conclusion on the vegetarian chili that I had there. I had some dousing my fries and then covered with some cheese and baked in the oven for a bit. WOW! These were damn good! I want to go back and try some of the other stuff because if the chili was any indication of what the rest of the menu is like, then I am sure to love everything else. Their drink special for a Monday is $1.75 PBRs. Come on now, even if you are not a big PBR fan you can't pass up this deal. Our server was good and he had a lot of patience to put up with my indecisive ass so extra kudos go out to him. Good food, cheap drinks and some kick ass company made for a fun night.

Handlebar had good food, i love their chili quesadillas, it may sound weird but I ate the whole thing, and didn't even share, thats how selfish the food made me.  The rest of the night i was having a tecate and tequila shot combo ($5 everyday).   The maggies made it fun as well, the whole crew was out and they officially inducted shannon into the group.  I was there to see the whole thing go down.  As for the other patrons, they mainly just stared but seemed afraid to come over and say hi. The outside patio was nice, we sat in the most perfect spot and i would like to build a replica of where we sat in my backyard.  So cozy.

I like the veggie aspect of the place. The Mac & Cheese was yummy and the price was right. The menu looked great and I would love to go back and try more of the food.  The beer was cheap with a  Monday special on PBR ($1.75). Guinness for $5.  The patio/beer garden was pretty sweet. It was great sitting out on such a nice night. The experience will be enhanced by the presence of fellow Yelpers and assorted Maggies. Here is the breakdown: * Wait staff: Not friendly, not unfriendly * Drink Menu: you name it and cheap PBR * Menu: Veggie-tarian Bar Food... mmmmm * Parking: Bike parking available, but don't drive. Parking is scarce and apparently frowned upon by the staff. Take the blue line and walk W. on North, its not far

I've been wanting to try this place for a while now and finally did on Saturday nite. Here is what I thought of the place....lets start with the bad. Bad:  1.  I asked a lady at Starbucks where the place was located and she sent me the complete opposite way!!! I had to ask a random couple walking by me if they knew where the place was. They sent me on the right track!! YAY cute couple!!! 2.  My "Chicken" seitan wrap was terrible. It tasted like faux fish. Remember those fish sticks they used to serve us in grammar school? Thats what this tasted like. It just had lettuce and 2 pieces of tomato from what I can remember. 3.  Gouda mac n cheese was not my cup of tea cuz it was my first time trying gouda and I didnt like it one bit. Good: 1. The weather that day was nice. 2. The appetizer was uber yummy, Black Bean Tostadas. Although as soon as they got there I noticed they were not tostadas but sopes. They should change the menu to Black Bean Sopes. 3. The waiter was nice...and cute.  4. The iced tea tasted like...iced tea.  It was an "ok" experience but may not go back.

I had been wanting to go here for the longest, but just had not made it yet. I rode my bike and didn't notice that they had a place right in front of the restaurant to lock your bike up to. After two different people told my friend directions and had her going the wrong way we finally met up.  We made it there about 6, just before they began to get super crowded. I had a beer and she had an Iced Tea and we ordered the Black Bean Tostadas appetizer. These were really good but not technically Tostadas. These were mini Sopes vs. being Tostadas, but were still really good. For the main meal I ordered the Black Beans Maduro, which was OhH so good. Layered crispy, sweet plantains, black beans, brown rice, jack cheese and a chipotle-tomato sauce. ahh this was seriously the ISH! A mixture of sweet and total spiceyness but not overspicy. It was just great and very filling.  My friend ordered the the Buffalo Chicken wrap, which she wasn't dissapointed but wasn't satisfied with either. We both agreed that the faux chicken in the wrap tasted more like faux fish sticks than chicken. She had this with the side of Smoked Gouda Mac n Cheese. Now this mac n cheese was just simply dope. I added a little pepper to it but it was amazing. She was not a big fan of Gouda soo she only ate a little bit of it.  Overall I really liked Handlebar, a lot of veggie options and drink choices and cool waitstaff...Yea, I'll be back.

Once during Lent I decided to quit eating meat and was starving. Known as a hipster/bikester bar based on the number of bearded gentlemen and bicycles locked outside of the place, I knew that if there was any a time I would appreciate vegetarian fare, it would be at Handlebar. I came in with my roommate and we sat at the bar and we ordered chorizo nachos and a meal of three sides consisting of grilled veggies sausage, garlic mashed potatoes, and some chili. As a diehard meataholic, the gluten wheat meat substitute did the trick and I felt like I was eating meat all over again.  The beers here and cheap and the place is moderately lit giving it a nice atmosphere. Hipster decoration with obscure art/signs/fliers line the walls and give it character and style. I am a fan of this place and would recommend it to meateaters who are weaning them self off of cow and pig and chicken.

Great beer, outdoor seating, veggie friendly fare and surly waitstaff - ah, bliss.   We actually sat indoors and it was stiflingly hot.  I would hope they could spring for a ceiling fan.  The salad I had (spinach, goat cheese, etc) was really doused in dressing - far too acidic for my taste.   I had a margarita since it was a gazillion degrees in there and although refreshing was really sweet - I suspect a generic mix.  Yet I could kind of forgive all of this 'cause they had some slammin' grownup mac & cheese made with smoked gouda and a groovy vibe.  Yes, that's right, groovy.  I'll definitely give it a second chance next time I'm in town.

I really like handlebar.  I always have a consistently good experience here.  The food and the beer selection have always been 5 star.  I havent ever had 5 star service here...but it has also never been bad. Handlebar is a great place for people watching...my favorites are the collared greens, black beans, bbq sandwich, and buffalo chicken sandwich (spicy!).  I've also tried the fish tacos...very tasty!

Oh man.  So good.  This is up there with Chicago Diner, but so far from me now:( Yeah, it's a happenin' place, so you might have to wait a while.  And here's a tip for when you're waiting in line: don't lean against the wall.  There are light switches there.  You'll accidentally flip the lights on and ruin the mood.  Everyone will look at you like they want to stab you in the eye because they are so hip and cool, and you are not.
Hello, welcome to the hippest vegan/vegetarian restaurant in Wicker Park. Would you care for some smoked gouda mac n' cheese? So fabulous I don't care if its contradictory. Good beer selection too.

I go here quite often and I have never had a bad experience here. But, one thing to note is that you will not get in the queue for table if your whole party is not with you. Other than that, great veggie selection, wonderful flourless chocolate cake and kalamazoo beers on tap! I miss the sesame tofu noodles but there are still plenty of other yummy options, Grilled tofu sandwhich, Black beans meduro and the nacho plate! The specials are usually more creative then the regular menu items but still very good.

I had a really great brunch at Handlebar recently.  The patio is wonderfully warm and pleasant, the service was great (our waiter had dimples and sparkling blue eyes, sigh...). Good coffee, great food (vegan and non vegans happily accommodated).  I had the breakfast burrito. We also got some pear pies that were on special, and they were amazingly, incredibly good. I like the bike theme, but the great food, comfy patio and sweet service really make me love Handlebar.
Nothing special. I ride a bike too, but I don't have to love this crappy place to prove it.

I really dig Handlebar.  Their black beans maduro is great, though it might make you sweat a little bit, and their grilled cheese sandwich is also deceptively good.  If the weather is nice, they have a patio which we can eat on, and they also have a good beer selection.  You may also see some interesting bikes back there; I've seen double-deckers and home-made recumbents when I've been there before.

I always wanted to like Handlebar. My husband lived in the neighborhood so we were usually here a few times a month. The food is really tasty and the beer selection is fantastic. I usually ordered the chili cheese fries and a Fat Tire. There's a pretty good selection of micro-brews. Music here was pretty good, too. Two things hold me back from loving this place. The service here is atrocious. On several occasions we would sit down and not be approached by a waiter for a half hour. There would only be one other table, but the waiter and bartender would just ignore us and come over at their convenience. The other thing that was annoying about this place is that it has a pretentious feel to it. The place is dripping with hipsters and you just get the feeling that the bartenders think they are better than everyone. You hate people that drive SUVs? That's nice. Now can we please get some freakin' service here?
$3 for a tecate and a shot of fucking tequila, menu items that can be "veganized" without turning them into sad p.c. protest slop, smoked gouda macaroni and cheese, and EGG ON EGG SANDWICH. bikes.

Vegetarian and vegan food choices abound, most of them top-notch. The  inventive chefs know how to whip up a special. It's easy to eat as healthily or unhealthily as you want; the menu is that diverse. If you're feeling decadent, go for the fry pies, especially the peanut butter and jelly ones. Get an order for your table to share or your insulin level will soar like the foreclosure rate, then plunge like the consumer confidence index.

I just had the most amazing brunch experience at Handlebar! For starters: the service was fantastic. Our server was an absolute peach, a freaking gem! The food? Holy smokes, my breakfast blew me away. I ordered the Huevos Diablo with avocado and can I just tell you how awesome they were? Not only did I get this gigantic plate of fresh greatness, you actually get a nice amount of avocado to accompany your breakfast. The coffee? I have never received so many wonderful refills of coffee at any brunch place before. For real. I am as jittery as a little jumping bean and I love it. This place is spot on with beverage refills, friendly service, and amazing food (my dish in particular).  Now, I just need to go back to drink their awesome selection of beer, yummy, yummy...

I would have given this place 2 stars if the food wasn't good but it was quite tasty.  The service sucked!! I sat at the bar for an hour waiting with a friend for the rest of our party to join us and was never asked if I wanted a drink. My friend finished her drink and was never asked if she wanted another. When we finally sat at a table, the waitress only got drink orders from 2 of 6 of us. I dunno. Maybe it was an off day but because of the service, I was really put off by Handlebar.  The food was awesome. I had the green meanie. The mac and cheese is so creamy. I love fresh cut fries with the skin on and theirs were fried morsels of perfection.  When I finally did get a drink I was not disappointed. The beer selection is amazing. I love a good beer and the selection of imports on tap was impressive.  Food 4 stars Beer selection 4 Service 2 stars

This place is really cute; they have excellent food, and an excellent beer selection. I highly recommend the bbq seitan sandwich or the buffalo "chicken" wrap w/ vegan ranch.   The only reason I'm giving 4 stars and not 5 is that I wish they'd go completely vegetarian and take the seafood off the menu.

I've been having dreams lately about the seitan stuffed ravioli in the squash sauce with spinach and hazelnuts. Honestly, twice now. The only other reoccurring dream I have is the one where I'm making out with Stephen Malkmus. Both kind of get me hot.

If I could eat here daily, I'd be a happy, happy girl.  I haven't come across anything on their menu that hasn't been a-fricken-mazing, and I doubt that I will.  Try the samosas.  And the gouda mac and cheese.  OH! And you can't pass up the green meanie sandwich.  And have a beer.  Damnit, now I'm drooling. The service was great, the outdoor dining in the back is great for warm sunny days, and you can't go wrong with the food and drinks.  5 stars all the way.

Awesome food here. I went here several weeks ago, and had their buffalo 'chicken' wrap, with chili and before I knew it my food was gone. In the midst of being in buffalo bliss I had embarrassed and diappointed myself by devouring my meal like a starving wolf. My only complaints were that it was hard to get a table because the place was packed (understandably so!), and that the location wasn't all that easy to get to via public trans. Otherwise, I'd indulge in this Mecca of exploding cosmic wonderfulness more often!

I went here for the first time about a month ago and absolutely fell in LOVE with this place! They have extensive vegan options, vegatarian options galore, and great selection of beer! The food was excellent! We got the vegan nachos for an app. and they were devoured by our group in minutes!  I went with a group of vegans, we all got something different and everyone LOVED their meal! I can't wait to visit handlebar again!

Love this place.  Another good joint to get vegetarian food!  It seems no matter when you go there is only a short wait to be seated and even if the restaurant is completely full the food arrives in a reasonable amount of time.  They play good music too.

I frickin' love this place.  Everything that I have had on the menu is great, with the exception of the pb and j pies (and that's only b/c we couldn't figure them out).  The breakfast burrito with chorizo, potatoes, etc. is great, as well as their breakfast sandwich.  The gouda mac and cheese is some of the best mac and cheese that I have ever had.  I swear, there's nothing bad here.

I'll start this with full disclosure. I'm not a vegetarian. That being said, they have good mac n' cheese here. Regardless of the food I just wasn't very impressed with the place. It feels stuffy in there and the service has been average. However, my girlfriend's a vegetarian and she likes it there.

Meat? Who needs meat? I've been dying to try this place for months and finally my friend Kim and I got to try this place yesterday for lunch. When you walk in, the place is not very large, tall ceilings, exposed brick, a bunch of tables, art, posters, cute, I like. We were told to sit where ever we wanted and we picked a small table in the front. Now there was a gentleman off to my left by the window who told the server how much he loved the meal and how he keeps forgetting about Handlebar and how he can't wait to come back. I get a little excited and giddy. I had been salivating over the menu all week and still was having a hard time finding something I could settle on. I was lucky for two reasons, I was done for the next six hours and there for could have a beer, they have a pretty interesting beer list and my friend Kim was willing to share an appetizer, trouble was which one? As I sipped on my small goblet of Hairy Eyeball, (yes, and it was a tasty brew), we were flipping coins between the samosas and the nachos, (okay all four appetizers), we finally ordered our nachos with soy chorizo and black beans. Kim got the grilled cheese with their Thai coconut soup and I got the Green Meanie, plantains and we split an order of their smoked Gouda mac and cheese.  We first got our nachos, holy carp batman! A huge pile of tastiness! This was big enough for four people to start off with, there was just two of us... and we had more food coming. The chips were freshly made, the black beans were great, fresh and I couldn't help not to pick at them for the rest of lunch. (On a side note, Kim got some indigestion from the soy chorizo, but on a side side note she is also 8 1/2 months pregnant and her digestion isn't what it normally is). We then got the rest of our food. We just started laughing at each other, obviously we had ordered way too much food, but we carried on. My Green Meanie, avocado, tomato, spinach, sprouts, herbed goat cheese, honey Dijon on whole grain toast which was really good as were the plantains which were crispy, sweet and savory all in one bite. Kim's grilled cheese, was ooey and gooey and cheesy goodness, although I didn't try her soup, she said it was good, though too spicy for her. Now for the mac and cheese. Crud. I am a big fan of another place's mac and cheese, this may take the top. Not overwhelming with cheese, but a great balance of sauce and smokiness. We were both quite happy with our lunch and as we waddled out because of our fullness, I couldn't help but think a few things... "I need to go for more vegetarian places, this was great." ...  "Did I leave the iron on?".... "I can not wait to come back here." P.S. Don't worry I didn't leave the iron on....

I really like this place, and in the summer it's great to sit in the beer garden.  They have interesting and flavorful vegetarian options -- and that smoked gouda mac and cheese is some of the best comfort food.  My absolute favorite though is the Black Beans Maduro--spicy, flavorful, and filling.  I've taken veggie and non-veggie friends here, and it seems like everyone likes this place.  I find that the clientele is always a good mix of different people, and the atmosphere is relaxing & laid back.

I love this place. Like REALLY love it.  The food is delish- even my bacon-loving husband can't get enough of their veggie fare. We went out with some friends last night for dinner- a big group, 10 in total, with no reservation and we were meeting up at 8 p.m. I don't know about you, but I'm totally that person who stresses about getting to places on time, always making reservations, etc... so last night when we got there at 8:10 and we were the first to arrive with a long wait for a table for 10- I was on the verge of panicking.  But that's what's so amazing about this place. It's so relaxed and laid back, you can't help but get sucked in- which isn't a bad thing. A $5 car bomb also helps loosen the nerves, but needless to say, everyone showed up and after a 45 minute wait, we sat and dinner proceeded. I had my staple- the Green Meanie with (obviously) mac 'n' cheese... SMOKED GHOUDA mac 'n' cheese!!!  In the summer, their backyard patio is a great place to have good beer, relax and enjoy the summer weather.  So all in all- I really love this place. It makes me yearn for the days when I was a UK Village resident and could hop on my bike to head over. Now it's the Western bus, but still, so worth it!!!
Pretty good vegetarian food, good beers, good peoples.  It's chock full of hipsters & the food is overpriced, though.  I ordered fish tacos & everyone around, including me, smirked.

I had a friend come in from the suburbs who's a crazy-vegetarian, so, I had to think quickly where we could go for dinner that would allow him to have more than two choices.  I remembered that Handlebar is no more than a mile away and a perfect place to take him. My friend got the Smoked Applewood Tofu, which was recommended by the server, and quickly polished off.  I had the Green Meanie and Gouda Mac n'Cheese, both of which were really yummy and I would order again without thinking about it.   The only downside to Handlebar is that it's a tiny place and you basically feel like you're on top of other people's tables.  So, if you don't mind meeting possible new friends this is a perfect place.

When I take my vegetarian friends out to eat, there's only one place I take em: McDonald's.  But that's just to fuck with them.  After the anger subsides, we head over to Handlebar because Chef Jenny and Lauren throw down the best vegetarian and vegan treats I've ever had.  But I eat everything, so that doesn't count, right?  I'll tell you what, hippie; proof of the delicious meal is always found in the smiling faces of my veggie dining buddies.
One word... MMMMMMMM! Anyone will like this place! It really just has great tasting food and a casual, laid-back feel. The Margaritas are great too!!!

okay. i know this is only one step away from crazy-cat-lady status, but i was that weirdo who went to brunch on a saturday morning ALONE! the staff were sweet as vegan doughnuts, the food was delicious and fast, the coffee a step a way from motor oil (just the way i like it) and i had an overall great time. i like the "decor" which looks like a bike punk went crazy with some bright paint and some posters in an industrial wasteland. this may be one of my new favorite places to get breakfast! as an aside, i had the vegan diablos and they were incredible and delicious, although a side of beans and rice at 10 am was a little strange.

We had a great lunch, around 1:30 pm on a Saturday, got seated right away. Debbie had the bbq seitan, I had the Mediterranean omelet. Service was good and fast, food was great, loved the atmosphere, and there was actually parking across the street!! Amazing.

Handlebar Cafe: location, location, location. The owners of Handlebar got it right when they decided to open the only vegetarian-friendly breakfast/lunch/dinner/bar spot on North Ave west of  Leavitt. They have a mild cyclist bent--there's a bike rack out back and a pipe in the front of the restaurant that doubles as a rack. Oh, yeah, and there's a Four Star sticker on the pseudo-rack in front too-- "street cred."  Whatever, that's where the "friendliness", bicycle or other, ends. Let's go through the service, shall we? Every time I've been here I have been served by this tall, intimidating shaved-head guy. He glares as he's taking your order, sighs audibly if asked a question about the menu, and, in general, embodies the word "goon." The last time I went I was served a Brooklyn Ale that was flat. When I told the server, he apparently did not believe me and brought it back to the bar to confer with the bartender and to taste it, at length, for himself. He then returned to the table to roll his eyes and tell me that yeah, it's flat and I wouldn't have to pay for it. No offer to, um, replace my beer with another?  OK on to the food.
